0.title: WhatsApp to show estimated time of arrival for file sharing: Report
0.article_body: A new WhatsApp feature will let users understand when a document is fully downloaded on their devices or uploaded to their servers, WABetaInfo reported. On uploading a document, a new label showing the estimated time of arrival appears in the chat bubble, under the document name. The feature has been released on WhatsApp beta for Android and iOS.

1.title: 1 killed, 25 injured as speeding car hits bus, making it skid on its side in Pune
1.article_body: A driver of a Swift car was killed and 25 passengers of a bus were injured when the car rammed into the bus coming from the opposite direction on the Pune-Ahmednagar highway, police said. The bus turned and skidded on its side before crashing into parked vehicles due to the collision. The accident was partially captured in a CCTV camera.

2.title: 3 of same family die by suicide in Kerala's Kochi over mounting debt
2.article_body: Three members of the same family allegedly died by suicide in Kerala's Kochi due to mounting debt, police said. The deceased's bodies were found by children in the family when they woke up on Monday morning, following which they alerted their neighbours about the incident. According to police, the family operated a flour mill and had allegedly incurred heavy losses.

3.title: Jada Pinkett Smith makes first appearance since Will Smith's Oscar slap
3.article_body: Actress Jada Pinkett Smith made her first public appearance on Saturday since her husband Will Smith slapped Chris Rock at the Oscars. She attended the opening of the Rhimes Performing Arts Center in Los Angeles and posed alongside television producer Shonda Rhimes and actress Debbie Allen. Jada also shared a picture of posing on the red carpet with the two.

4.title: No need to panic about the new XE coronavirus variant: NTAGI chief
4.article_body: National Technical Advisory Group on Immunisation (NTAGI) chief Dr NK Arora on Monday said there is no need to panic about the new XE variant of coronavirus. Omicron variants of the X series are not causing serious diseases and do not show a very rapid spread, Dr Arora said. "These variants will keep on occurring," he added.

5.title: Gurugram society residents protest 2 months after ceiling collapse
5.article_body: A group of apartment owners of Gurugram's Chintels Paradiso held silent protests on Sunday at various government offices two months after collapse of multiple ceilings in a building in the residential society. The group said they wanted to highlight the fact that little to no progress had been made regarding the CBI probe, structural audit and compensation to buyers.

6.title: Kanye looking for 'behavioural treatment' at luxury facility: Report
6.article_body: Kanye West is looking for "behavioural treatment" to "be a better human and better dad" for his four kids with ex-wife Kim Kardashian, reported Page Six. As per the report, he is "going away to get help" and his team is looking for places with a luxury component. This comes after Kanye's online harassment of Kim and boyfriend Pete Davidson.

7.title: Over 15,000 have signed up for govt’s yoga programme: Delhi govt
7.article_body: The Delhi government's 'Dilli Ki Yogshala', an initiative to provide free yoga training on demand in neighbourhoods, has seen over 15,000 enrolments since its launch in December last year, an official said. Around 9,500 people are getting trained in yoga every day and Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal announced in January that it would be available online for COVID-19 patients.

8.title: NITI Aayog ranks states on energy efficiency, Gujarat tops among larger states
8.article_body: NITI Aayog has released rankings for the State Energy and Climate Index (SECI) Round 1 and Gujarat has ranked first among larger states. It was followed by Kerala and Punjab, while Chhattisgarh, Madhya Pradesh and Jharkhand were placed at the bottom. Among smaller states, Goa topped the index which ranks states on energy efficiency, sustainability and four other parameters.

9.title: 40 e-scooters of Jitendra EV catch fire in a truck in Nashik, no casualties reported
9.article_body: As many as 40 electric scooters of Jitendra Electric Vehicles (Jitendra EV) caught fire on Monday after being loaded in a transport container in Nashik. The company said that the incident took place near its factory and no casualties have been reported. Jitendra EV is conducting an investigation to find the root cause of the fire.

10.title: Lost a lot of weight while shooting for Ali's action film: Shahid
10.article_body: Shahid Kapoor, speaking about his upcoming action film with director Ali Abbas Zafar, said it's a departure from the "typical" action movies. "It's a kind of action...I've not done before...It's an edgy action, it has...quirk to it," he added. Shahid further said doing action is very tiring, adding that he lost a lot of weight while shooting for the film.

11.title: Delhi's Museum of Prime Ministers to be inaugurated on Thursday
11.article_body: The Pradhan Mantri Sangrahalaya, or the Museum of Prime Ministers, is all set to be inaugurated on Thursday at the Teen Murti complex in New Delhi. The space recognises contributions of all 14 former PMs irrespective of ideology or tenure, officials of the Ministry of Culture said. The museum houses some personal items, gifts and memorabilia related to the PMs.

12.title: TN Assembly passes resolution against CUET, BJP walks out
12.article_body: The Tamil Nadu Assembly adopted a resolution urging the Centre to withdraw the proposal to conduct Common University Entrance Test (CUET) for admission in central varsities. The resolution was supported by all the parties including the main opposition AIADMK. However, BJP staged a walkout. The resolution claimed that CUET "will sideline the diverse school education systems across the country".

13.title: Maha BJP chief asks Congress to prove its Hindutva credentials
13.article_body: Maharashtra BJP chief Chandrakant Patil asked Congress to prove its Hindutva credentials by announcing that it welcomes the abrogation of Article 370. He was addressing a press conference after campaigning for BJP candidate for Kolhapur North Assembly bypoll. "If they want to preserve Hindutva in Kolhapur, then Congress should announce that it welcomes the removal of Article 370," Patil said.

14.title: Violence won't be tolerated: JNU as students clash over non-veg food
14.article_body: JNU on Monday said no violence will be tolerated on the campus, a day after some students were injured in a clash between two groups allegedly over serving chicken for dinner on Ram Navami. JNU urged students to maintain peace. An FIR was registered on a complaint filed by members of JNUSU, SFI, DSF and AISA against unknown ABVP students.

15.title: Whatever the result is, we're going to protect our environment: MI's Zaheer
15.article_body: MI's Director of Cricket Zaheer Khan has said whatever the result is this IPL season, they're going to protect their team environment. "You've got to be able to close those moments of the game where the momentum is shifting. We have...not been able to do that," he added. So far, MI are winless in their four games this season.

16.title: Teen dies after gangrape at TMC leader's son's party in WB; 'forcibly cremated'
16.article_body: A teenage girl died after being allegedly gang-raped at the birthday party of the son of a TMC panchayat member in West Bengal's Nadia. The girl's mother alleged that a group of people forcibly took her body for cremation before her death certificate was issued. Police, however, said the family cremated her. The TMC leader's son has been arrested.

17.title: Aishwarya orders room service for me, else I don't eat: Abhishek Bachchan
17.article_body: Actor Abhishek Bachchan in an interview has revealed that he has certain quirks including having a problem speaking to strangers on the phone. He added that during outdoor shoots, he can't call room service and his wife actress Aishwarya Rai calls room service to order food for him. "Otherwise she knows I won't eat. I have this issue," Abhishek said.

18.title: Amid rising fuel costs, Hyd techie designs 7-seater 'pedal car'
18.article_body: Amid rising fuel costs, a Hyderabad-based techie, Pranav Upadhyay, has designed community 'pedal car' for intracity commutes. The vehicle can accommodate seven people, five of whom can pedal car, while two seats are designed for differently-abled people. Upadhyay said that he seeks to combat air pollution through this initiative, adding that he'll design a more sustainable version of car soon.

19.title: 1 killed, 25 injured as car hits passenger bus on Pune-Ahmednagar highway
19.article_body: One person was killed and at least 25 others were injured after a speeding vehicle hit a passenger bus coming from the opposite side on the Pune-Ahmednagar highway late Sunday night. After the accident, the bus skidded off the road and hit three vehicles parked in front of a hotel. The car driver died on the spot.

20.title: I want to turn Prithvi Shaw into a player who plays over 100 Tests: Ponting
20.article_body: DC head coach Ricky Ponting has said their opener Prithvi Shaw has as much talent as he had if not more and he wants to turn the 22-year-old into a player who plays over 100 Tests. In their four matches in IPL 2022, Prithvi has scored 38, 10, 61 and 51 runs. Last season, Prithvi had scored 479 runs.

21.title: Farhan shares BTS clips from Rishi Kapoor's last film 'Sharmaji Namkeen'
21.article_body: Director-Actor Farhan Akhtar shared behind-the-scenes (BTS) clips from late actor Rishi Kapoor's last film 'Sharmaji Namkeen'. Alongside the post, he wrote, "Best moments served with love from the sets of #SharmajiNamkeen." Commenting on the post, actor Ronit Roy wrote, "Much senior to me but [he was] one of the best friends I had in the industry. I miss him."

22.title: UP govt's Twitter handle gets hacked, tweets on NFT trading posted
22.article_body: The official Twitter account of the Uttar Pradesh government was hacked on Monday morning, two days after UP CM Yogi Adityanath's Twitter handle was also hacked. The tweets posted by the hackers were related to cryptocurrencies and NFTs and were deleted after the account was restored. They also tagged a number of random accounts in subsequent tweets.

23.title: Punjab Congress' Twitter account gets hacked, location changed to 'Metaverse'
23.article_body: Punjab Congress' official Twitter account was hacked on Monday as their timeline was spammed with random users being tagged. The location of the account was also changed from 'Chandigarh' to 'Metaverse'. Recently, some of the prominent Twitter accounts including the Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister's Office and the University Grants Commission were hacked for a while by the miscreants.

24.title: Pic shows RK Studios decked up with lights ahead of Ranbir-Alia's reported wedding
24.article_body: A picture has surfaced online showing RK Studios in Chembur being decked up with lights ahead of Ranbir Kapoor-Alia Bhatt's reported wedding. On Sunday, visuals of Ranbir Kapoor’s under-construction house in Bandra surfaced online, showing the building being decorated with LED string lights. Alia's half brother Rahul Bhatt had earlier confirmed that the wedding is happening.

25.title: Jeff Bezos responds to Musk's poll to turn Twitter HQ into a homeless shelter
25.article_body: Jeff Bezos, Amazon Founder and the world's second-richest person, responded to a poll by the world's richest man, Elon Musk, on whether Twitter's San Francisco headquarters should be converted into a homeless shelter. "Or do portion. Worked out great and makes it easy for employees who want to volunteer," Bezos tweeted to Musk. Elon Musk responded "Great idea" to Bezos.

26.title: Rape destroys soul: Court on Mumbai attempted gang-rape case
26.article_body: A special POCSO court sentenced a 28-year-old man to 10 years of rigorous imprisonment for attempting to gang-rape a 15-year-old mentally challenged girl in Mumbai. The court observed that rape is "more heinous" than murder as it "destroys the soul" of the woman. The girl had reportedly told her mother that the accused had tried to lure her with ₹10.

27.title: Let's tune out noise, stay focused: Twitter CEO as Musk turns down board seat
27.article_body: After Elon Musk turned down the offer to join Twitter's board of directors, the company's CEO Parag Agrawal told his team, "Let's tune out the noise and stay focused on the work." He added, "There will be distractions ahead but our goals and priorities remain unchanged." Musk's appointment was "contingent on a background check and formal acceptance", Agrawal said.

28.title: She has been trolled & mocked: Neha on why she chose Rashami for her song Parwah
28.article_body: Speaking about her song 'Parwah', which also stars actress Rashami Desai, singer and ex-Bigg Boss OTT contestant, Neha Bhasin said, "I wrote the song after 'Bigg Boss OTT'. I was angry at that time...It started from...being misunderstood." "Then I met Rashami and thought, why not feature her because...she’s also been trolled a lot and mocked by the world," Neha added.

29.title: Ghaziabad school shut after 2 students test COVID-19 positive
29.article_body: A private school in UP's Ghaziabad was closed for three days after two students tested positive for COVID-19. In a letter to parents, the Principal said that the school management has decided to suspend offline classes from April 11 to 13 in order to break the infection chain. "We will continue imparting education through online classes," added the Principal.

30.title: 9 arrested over clashes in Guj's Khambat; Section 144 imposed in Himmatnagar
30.article_body: Police have arrested nine persons for their alleged involvement in communal violence and stone-pelting incidents during a Ram Navami procession in Khambhat city of Gujarat's Anand district, officials said. Additionally, Section 144 of the CrPC has been imposed in Sabarkantha district's Himmatnagar, where communal clashes were also reported. The prohibitory order will remain in force till April 13.

31.title: CPI MP urges PM to provide free COVID-19 vaccine booster doses
31.article_body: CPI MP Binoy Viswam has written a letter to PM Narendra Modi urging him to provide COVID-19 vaccine booster doses for free at public healthcare institutions. Criticising Centre's move to allow only private vaccination centres to administer paid booster shots to adults above 18 years, Viswam said that the privatisation of the vaccination drive is ill-planned and disastrous.

32.title: Apple starts making iPhone 13 in India
32.article_body: Apple confirmed that the company's manufacturing partner Foxconn has started assembling the iPhone 13 at its plant near Chennai. Foxconn also makes the iPhone 12 and iPhone 11 in India. "We are excited to begin making iPhone 13...right here in India for our local customers," Apple said.

33.title: Groom among 3 injured in celebratory firing in Raj; shooter accidentally kills self
33.article_body: A man, named in 13 criminal cases, injured three persons in celebratory firing, before accidentally shooting himself with his country-made pistol at a wedding function in Rajasthan's Sikar district, according to police. The groom, who sustained injuries, is also a criminal and is named in several cases. Five persons have been taken into custody for questioning, police added.

34.title: Actress Pranitha Subhash announces pregnancy, shares pics of ultrasound
34.article_body: Actress Pranitha Subhash took to Instagram to announce that she's expecting her first child with her husband Nithin Raju, who's a Bengaluru-based businessman. Pranitha, who appears in Kannada, Tamil, Telugu and Hindi movies, shared pictures of ultrasound with her over five million followers on Instagram. She wrote, "For my husband's 34th bday, the angels above have a present for us."

35.title: 16 women die after delivery every month in Delhi's 4 major govt hospitals: RTI
35.article_body: Around 16 women die after childbirth every month in four major government hospitals in Delhi, as per information released by hospitals under the Right to Information (RTI) Act. According to the information received, 1,281 women died after childbirth between January 2015 and September 2021 at AIIMS Delhi, Ram Manohar Lohia Hospital (RML), Safdarjung Hospital and Sucheta Kriplani Hospital

36.title: Names of 6 aides of ex-Pakistan PM Imran Khan added to 'stop list': Report
36.article_body: The names of six key aides of ousted Pakistan PM Imran Khan have been put on the 'stop list' by the FIA to prevent them from leaving the country, reports said. Khan's former principal secretary Azam Khan, ex-special assistant on political communication Shahbaz Gill and ex-adviser on interior and accountability Shahzad Akbar were reportedly added to the list.

37.title: Harshest action against Khargone rioters; will make them pay for damages: MP CM
37.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Monday termed the clashes in Khargone as "unfortunate" and said the harshest action will be taken against rioters, who have been identified. "Action doesn't mean only sending the offenders to jail. They'll be made to pay for the damage to public and private property," he added. "We're forming a 'Claims Tribunal'," Chouhan said.

38.title: Thar is Harsh Varrdhan's first film as producer; he's passionate about it: Anil
38.article_body: Speaking about his son Harsh Varrdhan Kapoor's first film as a producer, Anil Kapoor said Harsh Varrdhan has a unique approach and his choices of films are distinct. "[He's]...passionate about the project and he played an integral part in this film coming together," Anil added. "'Thar' is an experience and I can't wait for audiences to watch it!" Anil said.

39.title: Tiger found dead in Madhya Pradesh, 5th death in fortnight
39.article_body: A tiger was found dead at Pench Tiger Reserve (PTR) in Madhya Pradesh's Seoni district on Sunday. Officials suspect that the tiger, which was around two years old, was killed by another feline during a territorial fight. Five tigers have died so far since March 29 in Madhya Pradesh which reportedly has the highest number of tigers among all states.

40.title: Drunk man falls asleep in car in middle of Mumbai road causing traffic jam, held
40.article_body: A 34-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly stopping his car in the middle of a road in Mumbai's Borivali West and falling asleep in the vehicle, causing a traffic jam, police said. A police officer went up to the driver, woke him up and questioned him about his errant behaviour. Police added that the man was reeking of alcohol.

41.title: Never expected to get both Chahal, Ashwin in auction: RR's Sangakkara
41.article_body: RR's Director of Cricket Kumar Sangakkara has said they never expected to get both Yuzvendra Chahal and Ravichandran Ashwin in the auction. "I think they're the best two spinners going around so far...we're lucky and fortunate to have them and all we're trying to do is support them to get better," he added. Chahal picked four wickets against LSG.

42.title: Ded: Alia Bhatt on YouTuber recreating 'Kabir Singh' scene over reports of her wedding
42.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt took to Instagram to react to YouTuber Be YouNick recreating a scene from 'Kabir Singh' with reference to Alia's wedding with Ranbir Kapoor. In the video, the YouTuber can be seen running behind a car which had a placard behind it reading "Alia weds Ranbir." "Ded," Alia wrote commenting on the video.

43.title: I'm a firm believer in God; I go to church, temple, dargah: Vijay
43.article_body: Actor Vijay, during a recent interview, said that he respects all religions. "I'm a firm believer. I go to church, I've gone to temples and Ameen Peer Dargah during the filming of Thuppakki," he said, adding, "My mother is...Hindu and my father is Christian...I grew up in...household that never restricted me as to where I should go or shouldn't go."

44.title: Shahid's 'Jersey' postponed, film avoids clash with 'K.G.F: Chapter 2'
44.article_body: Shahid Kapoor-starrer 'Jersey', which was scheduled to release on April 14, has been postponed by a week. The Gowtam Tinnanuri directorial will now release in theatres on April 22, producer Aman Gill said. The sports drama has avoided the box office clash with Yash and Sanjay Dutt-starrer 'K.G.F: Chapter 2' and Vijay's action-thriller movie 'Beast'.

45.title: Prithvi took on the bowlers, we were clueless at that point: Shreyas
45.article_body: KKR captain Shreyas Iyer has said that they were "clueless" when DC opener Prithvi Shaw took on the bowlers during their match on Sunday, which they lost by 44 runs. "Prithvi can change the game in the powerplay...he hits good shots and...I [couldn't] figure out how to set the field for him," added Shreyas. Prithvi scored 51(29) in the game.

46.title: Man flashes, makes obscene gestures at girl in Pune; booked
46.article_body: A man has been booked for allegedly flashing and making obscene gestures at a girl who was on her way to attend a class on Pune's Tilak road. The incident had occurred in January, but the girl filed a complaint on Sunday as she was apparently in a state of shock. The accused had also reportedly stalked the girl.

47.title: 27-year-old man abused, extorted after contacting 'escort service' in Mumbai
47.article_body: A 27-year-old man was allegedly abused and extorted after he contacted an escort service to enquire about the rates for massages in Mumbai. The complainant was also threatened by the unidentified accused that a photo of the former's wife will be uploaded on an adult website, police said. The complainant alleged that ₹1,000 was extorted from him by the accused.

48.title: Man rapes sister's 15-yr-old friend in B'luru; shares video with friends
48.article_body: A 20-year-old man and his five friends, including two minors, have been arrested on charges of allegedly raping and sexually abusing his sister's 15-year-old female friend in Bengaluru. The man had reportedly recorded a video of raping the girl and shared it with the others. The man's friends had apparently then used it to sexually harass and extort the girl.

49.title: N Korea celebrates 10 years of 'gifted thinker' Kim Jong Un's rule
49.article_body: North Korea celebrated 10 years of its ruler Kim Jong Un's leadership on Monday. The government praised his political achievements and unveiled new portraits and exhibitions on the occasion. A senior official called Kim "a gifted thinker and theoretician, outstanding statesman and peerlessly great commander" and praised him for making the country "a full-fledged military power".

50.title: Ded: Alia Bhatt on YouTuber recreating 'Kabir Singh' scene over reports of her wedding
50.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt took to Instagram to react to YouTuber Be YouNick recreating a scene from 'Kabir Singh' with reference to Alia's wedding with Ranbir Singh. In the video, the YouTuber can be seen running behind a car which had a placard behind it reading "Alia weds Ranbir." "Ded," Alia wrote commenting on the video.

51.title: 2 killed, 10 wounded in nightclub shooting in US' Iowa
51.article_body: A shooting inside a nightclub left a man and a woman dead and 10 people wounded in US' Iowa on Sunday, authorities said. Cedar Rapids Police Chief Wayne Jerman said investigators believe two men fired more than a dozen shots inside Taboo Nightclub and Lounge just before 1:30 am Sunday. Police are searching for suspects and no arrests were reported.

52.title: 2 dead, 48 stuck midair for 16 hrs after J'khand's ropeway cable car collision
52.article_body: At least two people died and several sustained injuries after some cable cars in a ropeway collided with each other due to a technical snag at Trikut Pahar in Jharkhand's Deoghar on Sunday. According to officials, 48 people are still stuck in at least 12 cabins. Teams of Indian Air Force (IAF) and NDRF have been deployed for rescue operation.

53.title: David Beckham's son Brooklyn, actress Nicola Peltz share pics from their wedding
53.article_body: Former England football team captain David Beckham's eldest son Brooklyn Beckham and actress Nicola Peltz took to Instagram to share pictures from their wedding. The couple got married in Palm Beach in US' Florida last weekend. "This was amazing to experience...you guys are beautiful," singer Lloyiso commented on one of the pictures.

54.title: Shanghai to lift lockdown in some areas despite COVID-19 surge
54.article_body: Even as over 25,000 new COVID-19 cases were recorded in China's Shanghai on Sunday, the authorities have decided to lift the lockdown in some areas. According to an official, the city has been classified into three risk categories. He said that as many as 7,565 "prevention areas" will be reopened after two weeks without a positive case.

55.title: Anushka to shoot for 'Chakda 'Xpress' at Lord's Cricket Ground: Report
55.article_body: Anushka Sharma will reportedly shoot for 'Chakda 'Xpress' at the Lord's Cricket Ground in London.  The actress, who'll portray cricketer Jhulan Goswami in the upcoming biopic, is also expected to shoot at Headingley Stadium, the report stated. "Anushka is expected to shoot at...a few other big...stadiums. It looks like...she'll travel to at least four big stadiums," a source told Pinkvilla.

56.title: 40-yr-old woman held for misbehaving with police in Chandigarh
56.article_body: A 40-year-old woman was arrested for misbehaving with police officers at Manimajra Police Station, Chandigarh. The accused and her father allegedly abused an officer and recorded their interaction with the family. Police officers said the station has CCTV cameras and asked her to stop recording, following which she misbehaved with one of the woman Assistant Sub-Inspectors and injured her.

57.title: 10 students in auto-rickshaw injured after being hit by truck in Pune
57.article_body: At least 10 school children and a driver of an auto-rickshaw were injured after being hit by a mini-truck while they were on their way to their school in Pune's Uruli Kanchan area. According to the police, the injured students are aged between seven to 12 years and only a few of them including the driver have sustained serious injuries.

58.title: Kuldeep executed it well vs Stoinis and he's only going to get better: Boult
58.article_body: RR pacer Trent Boult praised his fellow pacer Kuldeep Sen for defending 15 runs in the final over against LSG, stating that the 25-year-old is only going to get better in the upcoming games. "Kuldeep executed it well [against Marcus Stoinis]," stated Boult. With Marcus Stoinis on strike, Kuldeep bowled three dot balls and conceded only 11 in final over.

59.title: Nadabet project will give employment to 5 lakh youth in 10 years: Amit Shah
59.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah, who inaugurated the border viewing point on the India-Pakistan international border in Gujarat's Nadabet, said the pilot project will provide employment to over five lakh youth in next 10 years. "I pay my homage to PM Narendra Modi's vision for he had come up with the idea of a multidimensional project for Nadabet," Shah added.

60.title: Hong Kong Customs seizes record methamphetamine haul worth ₹387 cr
60.article_body: Hong Kong Customs said on Sunday that it has seized a record haul of methamphetamine worth HK$400 million (approximately ₹387 cr) and arrested two men in the matter. About 447 kg of the suspected drug was hidden in three transformers, while the rest was found at a logistics warehouse in 10 pieces of industrial-use anti-vibratory rubber, it added.

61.title: Big B reunites with co-star Nafisa Ali for Uunchai; fan says 'Beautiful jodi'
61.article_body: Amitabh Bachchan reunited with his 'Major Saab' co-star Nafisa Ali Sodhi for his upcoming project 'Uunchai'. The two played a married couple in the 1998 film which also starred Ajay Devgn. Sharing pictures with Amitabh, Nafisa wrote, "My...handsome, amazing man...and adorable co-star Amitabh Bachchan." She also shared a throwback picture of them from 'Major Saab', and wrote, "How time flies."

62.title: Unfortunate that people in power promoted 'The Kashmir Files': Pawar
62.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar said it is "unfortunate" that people in power promoted 'The Kashmir Files' movie. "An individual made a movie (The Kashmir Files) showing atrocities on Hindus," Pawar added. "It depicted that in Kashmir, the Hindu Pandits were minorities and they were driven out during VP Singh-led government which was supported by BJP," Pawar stated.

63.title: Mysterious creature with human-like lips washes up on Australian beach, pic surfaces
63.article_body: A mysterious creature with human-like lips washed up on Bondi Beach in Australia. A jogger posted a video on Facebook of the creature and asked people to help him identify it. The jogger said that the animal appeared to be nearly half a metre long and had lips like a human and skin like a shark.

64.title: Musk tweets emoji with hand on mouth after Twitter CEO says he won't join Board
64.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk shared a laughing emoji with hand on mouth on Twitter about an hour after Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal announced that Musk has decided not to join its Board. Musk, who is Twitter's biggest shareholder, later deleted the tweet. Agrawal said that Twitter will value input from its shareholders, whether or not they are on the Board.

65.title: 1 killed, another injured in Gujarat during clashes amid Ram Navami procession
65.article_body: One person died and another sustained injuries after communal clashes broke out in Gujarat's Khambhat during a Ram Navami procession on Sunday. "The body of an unidentified man, who appears to be aged around 65 years, was recovered from the spot...where two groups pelted stones at each other," an officer said. A few shop cabins were also set on fire.

66.title: 29-yr-old man dies after being hit by BEST bus in Mumbai, driver held
66.article_body: An employee at an IT company was killed after allegedly being hit by a BEST bus in Mumbai's Mankhurd area. The driver was arrested but was later granted bail by a magistrate court, police said. The deceased Karan Dumbre (29) was going to his home on his motorcycle when the accident took place, officials from the Trombay Police Station said.

67.title: Bank manager among 4 held for stealing valuables worth ₹2.5 cr from lockers in UP
67.article_body: Four persons, including a bank manager, were arrested in connection with an alleged theft of valuables worth over ₹2.5 crore from the lockers of the Central Bank of India's Karachi Khana branch in Kanpur, police said on Sunday. Stolen ornaments weighing 342 grams have been recovered from the accused, Deputy Commissioner of Police (East), Pramod Kumar, said.

68.title: Wanted Sarfaraz for the end, that's why we sent Axar, Shardul over him: Pant
68.article_body: On being asked why Sarfaraz Khan wasn't sent in to bat after the fall of the fifth wicket against KKR, DC captain Rishabh Pant said they wanted the 24-year-old for the end of the innings. "We wanted momentum to keep going...we knew [even] if we lost wickets...we'd have Sarfaraz...and that's why we sent Axar and Shardul over him," explained Pant.

69.title: Ram Navami processions attacked in Howrah, Bankura: WB leaders
69.article_body: West Bengal Leader of Opposition Suvendu Adhikari on Sunday alleged that a Ram Navami procession was attacked by police in Howrah, saying, "Can't Sanatani devotees practice their religion in this state safely?" In another incident, Union Minister and state Lok Sabha MP Subhas Sarkar also claimed that a Ram Navami procession and his car were pelted with stones in Bankura.

70.title: Sec 144 imposed in village in J'khand's Lohardaga after communal violence
70.article_body: Communal clashes were reported in at least two districts of Jharkhand during Ram Navami processions on Sunday evening. In view of incidents of stone-pelting and arson, Section 144 of the CrPC has been imposed in Hirdi village of Lohardaga district, Sub-Divisional Magistrate (SDM) Arbind Kumar Lal said. Another instance of communal violence was reported in Bermo area of Bokaro district.

71.title: Queen Elizabeth II chats with COVID patients, staff at UK hospital
71.article_body: Queen Elizabeth II paid a virtual visit to a hospital in London and interacted with COVID-19 patients, doctors and nurses. The event marked the official opening of the Queen Elizabeth Unit, a critical care facility housing 155 beds. "It [COVID-19] does leave one very tired and exhausted, doesn't it?" the Queen told a couple recovering from the infection.

72.title: I once took up the role of Sita in Ramlila: Ravi Kishan
72.article_body: Actor-politician Ravi Kishan has said that he struggled for many years and played a lot of roles before achieving some level of success. He added that he even took up the role of Sita in Ramlila "for the sake of pursuing [his] passion for acting". Ravi further said his father didn't support him initially but his mother always supported him.

73.title: A RRRemarkable milestone: Ajay as 'RRR' crosses ₹1,000-cr mark globally
73.article_body: After 'RRR' crossed the ₹1,000-crore mark at the global box office, Ajay Devgn took to Twitter to congratulate the team of the action-drama film. "A RRRemarkable Milestone! Congratulations to the entire team of #RRR for a record-breaking run at box office," Ajay, who played a character named Venkata Rama Raju in the film, wrote. 'RRR' was released on March 25.

74.title: Lakhs of people come out in streets in support of Imran Khan in Pakistan
74.article_body: Lakhs of people across Pakistan came out in streets in support of ousted PM Imran Khan on Sunday. Khan tweeted a video from Lahore and wrote, "Never have such crowds come out so spontaneously and in such numbers in our history, rejecting the imported govt led by crooks." Protests also took place in Karachi, Peshawar, Islamabad, Rawalpindi and Abbottabad.

75.title: Macron to face Marine Le Pen in presidential election in France
75.article_body: French President Emmanuel Macron is set to face candidate Marine Le Pen in the presidential election runoff scheduled to be held on April 24. They emerged as the top two candidates after the first round of voting for the presidential election. Notably, Le Pen has called for banning hijab in public and halal butchers.

76.title: Earlier did some films to make my husband happy; I was like a chamchi: Neetu
76.article_body: Neetu Kapoor revealed earlier she did some films because of her husband, late actor Rishi Kapoor. She said, "There were films that I did with my husband and I was like a chamchi, he'd say 'come and do it'. I wouldn't do it on my own will." "I was doing (all that) trying to make my husband happy," she added.

77.title: War wouldn't have happened if Ukraine was in NATO: Ukraine minister
77.article_body: Ukraine Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba during an interview with NBC News said that the war with Russia wouldn't have taken place if the former country was "a member of NATO". He added that the "strategic mistake" by Germany and France in 2008, when they rejected US and its allies' efforts on the same, is "something that Ukraine is paying for".

78.title: Gujarat's education system is crumbling, says Arvind Kejriwal
78.article_body: AAP national convenor Arvind Kejriwal said that the people in Gujarat have begun to question the "crumbling education" system in the state being ruled by BJP for the last 27 years. Kejriwal promised that his party will provide just as "good education" to the students there as it is available in Delhi if voted to power in the upcoming polls.

79.title: Opposition is weak, BJP hammering it through probe agencies: Raut
79.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut has accused the BJP-led Centre of "hammering the opposition through central investigative agencies" which already is "weak". "Despite this, the opposition is not ready to surrender," Raut said. "The weak opposition is being hammered...and our HM (Amit) Shah says, they want to see a strong opposition! This joke is interesting," added Raut.

80.title: Muslims offer water bottles in Ram Navami procession in Siliguri
80.article_body: Muslim youths in West Bengal's Siliguri offered water bottles and hugged participants of a Ram Navami procession on Sunday. One of the Muslim volunteers said that they had done so to "foster affection among the people of different communities". "It is a nice gesture that they came forward to greet us on the occasion," a participant of the procession said.

81.title: 6 workers killed as blast at chemical factory triggers fire in Gujarat's Bharuch
81.article_body: Six workers were killed after a blast at a chemical factory in Gujarat's Bharuch district triggered a fire on Monday early morning. Bharuch SP Leena Patil said the victims were working near a reactor, which suddenly exploded during solvent distillation process. "The victims' bodies were later recovered and sent for postmortem. The fire was also brought under control," she added.

82.title: India reports 861 new COVID-19 cases, 6 deaths in 24 hours
82.article_body: India has reported 861 new COVID-19 cases, 929 recoveries and six more deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Union Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. It comes a day after the country reported 1,054 COVID-19 cases and 29 deaths. India's active caseload currently stands at 11,058, while the death toll reached 5,21,691.

83.title: How does the IPL 2022 points table read after 20 matches?
83.article_body: After the first 20 matches of IPL 2022, RR, KKR, GT, RCB and LSG have accumulated six points each. RR are on top of the table due to a superior net run-rate. GT are the only unbeaten team in the tournament so far, while defending champions CSK and five-time champions MI are yet to win a match.

84.title: 2 arrested for selling adulterated ghee in Delhi
84.article_body: The Delhi Police have arrested two people for allegedly selling adulterated ghee. The police said they recovered over 1,200 litres of adulterated ghee in packages of different brands. The matter came to light when a ghee manufacturing firm complained that some people were tampering with packets of the company's original product and adding fake ghee to them.

85.title: Shreyas Iyer's wicket was very important for me: Kuldeep on 4/35 vs KKR
85.article_body: DC spinner Kuldeep Yadav, who picked four wickets against KKR during their match on Sunday, has said KKR captain Shreyas Iyer's wicket was "personally very important" for him. "Shreyas was batting well and I wanted to make him guess. It was a very big wicket," he added. Apart from Shreyas, Kuldeep dismissed Pat Cummins, Sunil Narine and Umesh Yadav.

86.title: Fire destroys 200 acres of standing wheat crop in Haryana's Karnal
86.article_body: A fire on Sunday destroyed a standing wheat crop spread over 200 acres in Haryana's Karnal, with farmers claiming that the gutted crop and fodder were worth ₹1 crore. Five fire tenders were rushed to the spot and took several hours to put out the blaze. The fire had allegedly broken out due to a spark in the reaper machine.

87.title: IMD predicts relief from heatwave conditions over northwest India from April 12
87.article_body: The IMD has predicted some respite from the ongoing heatwave conditions over northwest India from Tuesday. IMD attributes this to an approaching fresh western disturbance, which will affect the western Himalayan regions from the night of April 12 and bring cooler winds over the heated regions. The maximum temperatures are likely to fall by 2-3°C over parts of northwest India.

88.title: Bihar govt official among 8 held for stealing 60-feet long iron bridge
88.article_body: Bihar Police arrested eight persons including a Sub Divisional Officer (SDO) of the Water Resources Department in connection with the theft of a 60-feet long abandoned bridge in Rohtas, an official said. According to the police, the thieves arrived with JCBs, pickup vans, gas cutters and vehicles and in three days they cut off the entire bridge and disappeared.

89.title: Actor Shiv Kumar Subramaniam passes away 2 months after 15-year-old son's demise
89.article_body: Actor-screenwriter Shiv Kumar Subramaniam, who featured in films like '2 States', 'Hichki' and 'Nail Polish', passed away two months after his 15-year-old son's demise. The cause of his death is not known yet. He had started his journey in film industry with writing the screenplay of Vidhu Vinod Chopra's 'Parinda' in 1989, for which he also won a Filmfare Award.

90.title: Elon Musk has decided not to join the Twitter board, says CEO Parag; shares note
90.article_body: Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal has said that Elon Musk, who is Twitter's biggest shareholder, won't join the company's board. Parag shared a brief note he sent to the company, wherein he wrote, "Elon's appointment to the board was to become officially effective 4/9, but Elon shared that same morning that he will no longer be joining the board."

91.title: 10 injured as cable cars in Jharkhand ropeway collide, nearly 50 stuck midair
91.article_body: At least 10 tourists were injured, including two seriously, after some cable cars in a ropeway collided with each other at Trikut hills close to Baba Baidyanath Temple in Jharkhand’s Deoghar district on Sunday, officials said. As per eyewitnesses, 50 people are still stuck in at least 12 cabins in the ropeway and a rescue operation is underway, PTI reported.

92.title: We have this history, we're not getting really good starts: Shreyas Iyer
92.article_body: KKR captain Shreyas Iyer has said their top-order's form is something they need to work on in their upcoming games in IPL 2022. "We have this history...we [aren't] getting really good starts," he stated. Chasing 216 to win against DC, KKR were 43/2 after the powerplay and then lost by 44 runs. This was KKR's second defeat in five games.

93.title: Delhi Metro to bring in advanced scanners at stations in phases
93.article_body: The Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) has said that it will install "highly advanced and state-of-the-art baggage scanners at stations in a phased manner". According to officials, 34 advanced scanners were installed under the first phase of the plan and about 250 more of them will be brought in across all metro stations by the end of 2022.

94.title: Students at Pune’s SPPU demand better food, hostel facilities
94.article_body: The students of Savitribai Phule Pune University (SPPU) held protests demanding improvement in food quality in the canteens and expansion in hostel accommodations. According to students, the hostel admissions have not started with full capacity due to which they are forced to stay at costlier rented flats. A university official said the students' demands will be looked into.

95.title: Enjoyed De Kock's wicket the most: Chahal on picking 4 wickets vs LSG
95.article_body: RR spinner Yuzvendra Chahal, who was named Man of the Match for picking four wickets for 41 runs against LSG, has said he enjoyed taking Quinton de Kock's wicket the most in the game. "De Kock could've changed the game," he added. Chahal has now become the purple cap holder with 11 wickets in four games.

96.title: Curfew in 3 areas of MP's Khargone after stones hurled at Ram Navami procession
96.article_body: A curfew has been imposed in three areas, including Talab Chowk and Tavdi, of Madhya Pradesh's Khargone after stones were hurled at a Ram Navami procession on Sunday, which led to clashes and incidents of arson. Police fired tear gas shells to control the situation. Khargone District Collector said Section 144 of CrPC has been imposed in the entire city.

97.title: Imran Khan's niece Zayn gives an update on the actor, says 'He is happy'
97.article_body: Former actor Imran Khan's niece Zayn Khan shared an update on him. On Sunday, during an Ask Me Anything session on Instagram, a fan asked Zayn, "What's Imran Khan doing these days?" To which, Zayn replied, "He's being a father, he is being himself and...he's...happy and I think when people pull back asking for space, we should give them that."

98.title: Pune City Police conferred 'Best Police Unit' in Maharashtra award
98.article_body: Pune City Police tweeted on Sunday that it's been conferred the 'Best Police Unit' in Maharashtra award. The police also shared a picture of state Home Minister Dilip Walse-Patil handing over the award. "[We'll] strive to address all issues, big and small consistently and make Pune one of the safest cities anywhere in the world with your support," police said.

99.title: Man killed in scuffle over phone theft at Pune’s Ekvira pilgrimage
99.article_body: A 49-year-old man from Thane was killed and two of his friends were injured after they got into a fight with some street performers over the suspicion of phone theft at Pune's Ekvira pilgrimage. The deceased, Manoj Patil, was struck several times with bamboo sticks and stabbed in the chest. The police have arrested two of the suspects.

100.title: Sale, use and distribution of single-use plastic banned in Gurugram from July 1
100.article_body: The manufacturing, importing, stocking, distribution and sale of single-use plastic will be banned across Gurugram with effect from July 1. According to civic body officials, violation of the rule will attract a maximum fine of ₹25,000. Seven teams, each having five officials, have been constituted to monitor and enforce penalties for single-use plastic violations, a senior official said.

101.title: Kajol remembers dad on his death anniversary, shares old pic
101.article_body: Actress Kajol on Sunday shared a post on Instagram marking the 14th death anniversary of her filmmaker-father Shomu Mukherjee. She shared an old picture with her father, and wrote, "14 years ago today you left me. I feel it till today, miss you." Kajol's sister Tanishaa also shared a post on her Instagram Stories. "Miss you dad," she wrote.

102.title: We were 14/3, but we knew we had a chance: Rahul on 3-run defeat vs RR
102.article_body: After their 3-run defeat against RR, LSG captain KL Rahul said they have a team that's never out of the contest. "Even when we are [14/3], we knew we had a chance...Games like this will give us confidence and remind us that we are a good team," he added. Chasing RR's 165-run total, LSG could score 162/8 in 20 overs.

103.title: 1 lakh square feet of B'luru's Gattahalli lake encroached: Report
103.article_body: Local activists have claimed that over one lakh square feet of the Gattahalli lake in Bengaluru has been encroached by land sharks, the Indian Express reported. Last year, the revenue department had removed some encroachments, but locals said that the lake is "repeatedly encroached". "[The lake is] under danger due to rampant illegal constructions," Citizens Movement, East Bengaluru said.

104.title: Doctors remove tooth from lungs of 6-year-old boy in Mumbai after he couldn't breathe
104.article_body: Doctors from Wockhardt Hospitals in Mumbai removed a tooth from the right lung of a six-year-old boy after he accidentally swallowed it and wasn't able to breathe or eat. ENT consultant Dr Sangamlal Pal said the patient was shifted to paediatric ICU post-operation. The boy's father said he can breathe freely now and has got a fresh lease of life.

105.title: 100 capsules containing cocaine taken out of Kenyan national's body in Mumbai
105.article_body: A 23-year-old Kenyan national was arrested for allegedly smuggling cocaine worth ₹9 crore in Mumbai. Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) officials intercepted him at the international airport based on specific information and sent him for medical examination when nothing was found after they examined his baggage. At the hospital, 100 capsules containing cocaine were taken out of his body.

106.title: I felt Shahid was an arrogant man on sets of Kabir Singh: Jersey actor Geetika
106.article_body: Actress Geetika Mehandru, who worked with actor Shahid Kapoor in 'Kabir Singh' and 'Jersey' said that on the sets of 'Kabir Singh', she thought that Shahid was arrogant and moody. "But he is not. He just is in the character," she added. "Because of 'Jersey', I spent more time with him... [and] realised he's not somebody who's arrogant," Geetika said.

107.title: What does the law say about batters retiring during the innings?
107.article_body: RR's Ravichandran Ashwin became the first batter to be retired out in IPL history during their match against LSG. As per the law, a batter retires out if he retires without the umpire's permission and doesn't have the permission of the opposing captain to resume his innings. It is considered a dismissal for the purposes of calculating batting average.

108.title: Bangladesh's Mehidy Hasan gets hit on stomach after 'brain fade', video goes viral
108.article_body: On the second delivery of South Africa's second innings in the second Test, Bangladesh's Mehidy Hasan dropped a catch and was hit on the stomach after a "brain fade" moment. Mehidy didn't spot the ball after Sarel Erwee cut it towards the backward point. Mehidy was looking at his left and seemed to lose the ball under the lights.

109.title: Most successful people have a lot of skill and grit: Google's former CEO
109.article_body: Google's former CEO Eric Schmidt said the most successful people have a lot of skill and grit. "They're willing to put up with the setbacks and the inevitable challenges that people deal with in their...lives," the billionaire told CNBC. He added that he always wanted "a seat at the table", even if he didn't understand his ambition at the time.

110.title: RR end LSG's 3-match winning streak, jump to top of IPL 2022 points table
110.article_body: RR fast bowler Kuldeep Sen, playing in his first-ever IPL match, defended 15 runs in the last over to help his team defeat LSG by three runs. With this, RR ended LSG's three-match winning streak. RR have now jumped to the top of the IPL 2022 points table with three victories and a superior net run-rate of +0.951.

111.title: 14 unicorns created, $10.8 bn invested in startups in Q4 FY22: Report
111.article_body: As many as 14 startups attained the unicorn status in India in Q4 FY22 with the startup ecosystem attracting investment of $10.8 billion, a report by accounting firm PwC India said. With 334 funding deals in the quarter, India now has a total of 84 unicorns. With five unicorns, the software-as-a-service (SaaS) sector accounted for the largest sector-wise share.

112.title: Mexicans vote in first-ever referendum against President
112.article_body: Mexicans on Sunday began voting in a referendum on whether President Andrés Manuel López Obrador should end his term barely midway through or continue to the end. Obrador had himself pushed for the first so-called recall referendum in modern Mexico. Critics have claimed the referendum is a waste of money, which will cost the public exchequer almost $80 million.

113.title: Students clash in JNU over non-veg food, Ram Navami pooja; some injured
113.article_body: Some students in Delhi's JNU sustained injuries following a clash between members of ABVP and the Left-wing over the consumption of non-vegetarian food and the conduct of Ram Navami pooja. ABVP allegedly tried to stop non-veg from being cooked in Kaveri hostel mess. As per ABVP, however, Left-wing students tried to disrupt Ram Navami pooja. Police have been called in.

114.title: I am serious: Musk on poll to turn Twitter headquarters into homeless shelter
114.article_body: Elon Musk, the world's richest person and Twitter's biggest shareholder, tweeted, "I'm serious about this", about a poll to turn Twitter headquarters in San Francisco into a homeless shelter. At the time of writing, over 91% of the respondents had voted in favour of turning the Twitter headquarters into a homeless shelter. Musk was recently named to Twitter's board.

115.title: 1,222 bodies found in Kyiv region so far: Ukrainian official
115.article_body: Ukraine's Prosecutor General Iryna Venediktova on Sunday said that 1,222 bodies have been found in the region around Kyiv so far. The areas around Ukraine's capital were recently retaken by Ukrainian forces during a retreat by Russian forces in northern Ukraine. The Ukrainian government has accused the Russian forces of committing atrocities against the civilians during their occupation.

116.title: Private taxidermy museum with over 1,000 stuffed animals found in Spain
116.article_body: Spain is investigating a businessman who owned a private taxidermy collection with more than 1,000 stuffed animals. The collection includes over 400 specimens from protected species and at least one specimen of a North African oryx, already extinct. Stuffed animals were found in two warehouses extending over 50,000 square metres on the outskirts of Spain's Bétera.

117.title: Planning permanent military presence on our eastern borders: NATO chief
117.article_body: NATO is working to set up a permanent military presence along its eastern borders in a bid to counter any future Russian threat, Secretary-General Jens Stoltenberg said. He added that the bloc is "in the midst of a very fundamental transformation", which will reflect "long-term consequences" of Putin's actions. Stoltenberg's tenure as NATO chief has been extended till September 2023.

118.title: Capitan, you've done it again: Rana on RRR crossing ₹1,000 cr globally
118.article_body: Actor Rana Daggubati, taking to Twitter, congratulated filmmaker SS Rajamouli after his film 'RRR' crossed ₹1,000 crores globally after 16 days of its release. "'ONE INDIA ONE CINEMA' was...wishful dream till one man came along and said this is what it looks like!! Capitan, you've done it again," he tweeted. Rana and Rajamouli have worked together in the 'Baahubali' franchise.

119.title: BJP doesn't have patent for Hindutva: Uddhav Thackeray
119.article_body: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Sunday said BJP doesn't hold the "patent for Hindutva" and that Shiv Sena has always been committed to bhagva (saffron) and Hindutva. "I wonder had Lord Ram not been born, what issue the BJP would have raised in politics. Since BJP is bereft of issues, it is talking about religion and [spreading] hatred," Thackeray said.

120.title: I had no idea, I just turned and saw him go off: Hetmyer on Ashwin retiring out
120.article_body: Talking about Ravichandran Ashwin retiring out in 19th over against LSG, RR's Shimron Hetmyer, who was the other batter on the pitch at the time, said, "I literally had no idea about it." He added, "I just turned and saw him go off. He was a...bit tired. It was a good decision as Riyan Parag hit a six," Hetmyer said.

121.title: Clashes break out during Ram Navami processions in 2 Gujarat cities
121.article_body: Clashes were reported during Ram Navami processions in Himmatnagar and Khambhat in Gujarat on Sunday. Two groups pelted stones at each other, damaged shops and vehicles, following which the police fired tear gas shells to control the situation. The number of injuries recorded in both incidents is not known yet, officials said.

122.title: Would be intimidated if I'm offered film with Hrithik Roshan: Shahid
122.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor said he would be intimidated if he is offered a film with actor Hrithik Roshan. "Because I...love Hrithik as an action hero and I really love him as a dancer so I would...be very nervous," Shahid stated. "I would tell him to do a bit of 'Haider' type role? Because that is my comfort zone," he added.

123.title: Was bathroom singer, thought why not take it seriously: Tiger Shroff
123.article_body: Tiger Shroff said he was a bathroom singer and added he sang well. "I thought why not take it seriously...I just wanted to start it as a hobby," he stated. "One of my goals in life was to perform on stage and sing...dance to my...songs," he added. Tiger made his singing debut in Bollywood with 'Heropanti 2' song 'Miss Hairan'.

124.title: Sri Lankan economic crisis may cause more deaths than COVID: Doctors
124.article_body: The economic crisis in Sri Lanka may lead to more deaths than those caused by COVID-19, according to Sri Lanka Medical Association (SLMA). All hospitals in the country no longer had access to imported medical tools and vital drugs, it claimed. "We're made to make very difficult choices. We've to decide who gets treatment and who will not," it said.

125.title: I bowl googlies more than leg-break as it turns more: RCB's Hasaranga
125.article_body: Royal Challengers Bangalore spinner Wanindu Hasaranga has said that he bowls googlies more than leg-spin deliveries because his googly "turns more than" his leg-break delivery. Speaking about his team's seven-wicket win over Mumbai Indians on Saturday, Hasaranga said, "Definitely happy with my performance, but happier with the team's win." Hasaranga scalped two wickets in the IPL 2022 match.

126.title: Video of Pak PM candidate knocking off mics during speeches goes viral
126.article_body: A video of Pakistan PM candidate Shehbaz Sharif knocking off microphones while delivering speeches has gone viral online. The video shows Sharif hitting mics with his hand gestures on several occasions while speaking at public events in Pakistan. "India mustn't take Shehbaz Sharif lightly. He's literally a mover and shaker," said one Twitter user on the video.

127.title: Don't know why I didn't get much work when I was younger: Ratna
127.article_body: Veteran actress Ratna Pathak Shah has stated that she doesn't know why she didn't get much work when she was younger, adding there was something about her that wasn't acceptable. "I was just not looked at, maybe because I was (Naseeruddin Shah's) wife and they thought I was just not interested in working. Thankfully that's done and dusted," Ratna added.

128.title: Carter and I would love to have twins: Paris Hilton
128.article_body: American socialite and businesswoman Paris Hilton has said that she would "love" to have twins with her husband Carter Reum. "I would like a twin boy and girl just to, like, get both...I would love that or twin girls because I love girls," she told the People magazine. Paris and Carter tied the knot in November last year.

129.title: Tunisians rally against Prez Saied, accuse him of 'failed dictatorship'
129.article_body: Thousands of Tunisians took to the streets in capital Tunis to protest against President Kais Saied, accusing him of imposing one-man rule in Tunisia after he dissolved parliament last month. "We are facing a failed dictatorship...We will continue to protest...until...coup is forced to reverse its decisions," a protester said. Saied also dissolved Tunisia's Supreme Judicial Council in February.

130.title: BJP gave freedom to UP's private schools to raise fees: Sisodia
130.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Sunday said BJP-led Uttar Pradesh government has given the state's private schools the freedom to increase their fees. "Within 10 days of government formation...[Punjab] CM Bhagwant Mann issued an order saying private schools cannot increase their fees," Sisodia said. Delhi's private schools have been stopped from arbitrarily increasing fees since 2015, he added.

131.title: UP vegetable sellers' daughter Mumtaz stars in junior women's hockey World Cup
131.article_body: Mumtaz Khan, the 19-year-old daughter of vegetable sellers Qaiser Jahan and Hafiz Khan from Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow, helped India beat S Korea in the junior women's hockey World Cup quarterfinal on Friday. "I would've loved to watch her score the goal, but I've got to earn a living as well," her mother, who was selling vegetables during Mumtaz's match, said.

132.title: Ravichandran Ashwin becomes first cricketer to be retired out in IPL history
132.article_body: Rajasthan Royals (RR) all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin has become the first cricketer to be retired out in IPL history. Ashwin left the field in the 19th over of RR's innings against LSG after scoring 28(23). A batter is considered retired out if he retires his innings without the umpire's permission and cannot resume the innings.

133.title: Andhra CM inducts 14 new ministers into Cabinet in massive reshuffle
133.article_body: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Jagan Mohan Reddy has reconstituted his Cabinet and inducted 14 new ministers. He has retained 11 ministers, including Deputy CM K Narayanaswamy, Women and Child Welfare Minister Taneti Vanita and Social Welfare Minister Pinipe Viswarupu. The revamped Cabinet will see 68% representation from Scheduled Castes, Scheduled Tribes and Backward Classes.

134.title: Worry about your own kids: Khloé to trolls saying she holds daughter too much
134.article_body: Television personality Khloé Kardashian took to Twitter to react to trolls saying that she holds her daughter 'too much' after she carried her during the Los Angeles premiere of 'The Kardashians'. "I'm gonna hold my baby until I can't hold her anymore...When there's tons of cameras around...I want my baby to feel safe. Worry about your own children," she wrote.

135.title: You’ll get Twitter verification back, even if you shorted Tesla: Musk to investor
135.article_body: World's richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk responded after American investor Michael Burry, who was portrayed in the movie 'The Big Short', said he was no longer a verified user on Twitter. "You will get it back, even though you shorted Tesla," Musk, the largest shareholder of Twitter, said. Burry ditched his bearish bets against Musk-led Tesla last year.

136.title: Russian rocket attack completely destroyed Dnipro airport: Ukraine
136.article_body: Russian forces fired rockets into Ukraine's Dnipro on Sunday, completely destroying an airport in the city, a local official said. Attacks on the city, which lies on the banks of Dnieper River, intensified on Sunday, the official added. Five staffers of the state emergency service were wounded by the strike on the airport, the head of Dnipro region council said.

137.title: Cong neither Indian nor national, only brother-sister party: Nadda
137.article_body: While addressing a gathering in Himachal Pradesh's Bilaspur, BJP president Jagat Prakash Nadda on Sunday said that Congress is neither Indian nor national, but only a brother-sister party. He further said, "Apart from BJP, there is no political party in the country that runs without promoting familism, many opposition parties have become regional parties only."

138.title: Important to have a second income to be choosy: Angad Hasija
138.article_body: Television actor Angad Hasija has stated that it is important to have a second income if one wants to be choosy with roles, else they would have to do whatever is offered. He is also a qualified architect and interior designer. "[My mom] wanted me to be an actor and that is how I came in this field," Angad added.

139.title: Sitaram Yechury re-elected as CPI(M) General Secretary for 3rd term
139.article_body: Sitaram Yechury was re-elected as General Secretary of CPI(M) for a third consecutive term at party's 23rd congress meet in Kerala's Kannur on Sunday. A 17-member politburo and 85-member central committee was also inducted at meet. Yechury, who was first elected to the post in 2015, had succeeded senior party leader Prakash Karat, who held the post for 10 years.

140.title: COVID-19 vaccines working against all variants: WHO chief scientist
140.article_body: COVID-19 vaccines are working against all variants of the SARS-CoV-2 virus at this point in time in preventing severe disease and death, said World Health Organisation (WHO) chief scientist Dr Soumya Swaminathan. "In the future, if we need to, we may have to change the composition of vaccines and we need to be prepared for that," she further said.

141.title: He's an idealist: Simi Garewal shares 2 learnings from Imran Khan's exit as Pak PM
141.article_body: Former actor and TV show host Simi Garewal on Sunday tweeted about what Imran Khan's exit as Pakistan PM taught her, saying, "1. A joint opposition can dismiss a popular Prime Minister. 2 Politics is no place for idealists." She added, "I've known Imran for 40 years and idealism is at his core."

142.title: Virat Kohli meets Baby AB after getting out to him, MI share video
142.article_body: RCB batter Virat Kohli met MI's Dewald Brevis, who is nicknamed Baby AB, after getting out to him in their IPL 2022 clash on Saturday. Kohli was adjudged LBW out on what was Brevis' first-ever delivery in IPL. "Young man! Good one, eh! Good first meeting. [Getting] me on the first ball," Kohli was heard telling Baby AB.

143.title: Bridge over dry river bed collapses as 138-wheel lorry crosses it in MP
143.article_body: A British-era bridge in Madhya Pradesh's Narmadapuram collapsed when a 138-wheel lorry was crossing it on the dry Sukthwa river. No injury was reported in the incident, Additional Superintendent of Police Awadhesh Pratap Singh said. After the incident, vehicular traffic was affected on the Bhopal-Nagpur highway and traffic was being diverted via Harda to Betul.

144.title: India accounts for 114 space debris, lowest in the last 4 years: NASA
144.article_body: Indian space assets account for 114 space debris, according to the latest issue of Orbital Debris Quarterly News published by NASA's Orbital Debris Program Office. India's contribution to space debris has fallen to the lowest levels in the last four years, the data showed. Earlier, NASA had said that India's anti-satellite test in 2019 had created "dangerous" space debris.

145.title: Jr NTR liked my story for 'NTR31', have been his big fan: Prashanth
145.article_body: Filmmaker Prashanth Neel, talking about his upcoming film with Jr NTR, has said the actor liked his story. "Please don't ask me about the genre of that movie because it's far off at the moment," he stated about the film that is tentatively titled 'NTR31'. Prashanth revealed he is a "big fan" of the actor for the last 20 years.

146.title: PM Modi & Biden to hold virtual meet tomorrow to 'deepen ties'
146.article_body: US President Joe Biden will hold a virtual meeting with PM Narendra Modi on Monday to "further deepen ties between our governments, economies, and our people", a US official said. "Biden will continue our close consultations on...consequences of Russia's brutal war against Ukraine," the official added. The meeting will precede the India-US 2+2 Ministerial Dialogue, the official further said.

147.title: Soni Razdan asked not to discuss it: Mukesh Bhatt on Alia-Ranbir wedding
147.article_body: Alia Bhatt's uncle filmmaker Mukesh Bhatt, on being asked about her wedding with Ranbir Kapoor, has stated that he is not in a position to say anything at this time. "My sister-in-law (Soni Razdan) has asked to refrain from discussing anything about this marriage," Mukesh added. Alia and Ranbir are reported to get married on April 14 in RK Studios.

148.title: BJP govt in UP has failed on all fronts: SP chief Akhilesh Yadav
148.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav on Sunday said that the Uttar Pradesh government has failed on all fronts and the BJP is insensitive towards the problems of the youth. Yadav further said that BJP wants to rule the state by making people feel afraid, "which is highly condemnable in a democracy," adding that BJP has defamed UP.

149.title: Ram Janmbhoomi Temple's construction will be completed by Dec 2023
149.article_body: The construction of the Ram Janmbhoomi Temple in Ayodhya is in full swing and will be completed by December 2023, Shri Ram Janmbhoomi Teerth Kshetra General Secretary Champat Rai said. "Efforts are being made to install Lord Ram's idol in the sanctum sanctorum of the temple in 2023," Rai added. Construction work was interrupted earlier due to the pandemic.

150.title: 17-yr-old beaten by girl's family over suspected relationship in Guj
150.article_body: Gujarat's Panchmahal Police on Sunday arrested five people for allegedly assaulting a 17-year-old boy and two of his friends on the suspicion that he was in a relationship with a girl from the village. Police registered an FIR after a video that purportedly shows the boy and his friends being beaten with sticks surfaced online, reports said.

151.title: Cattle smuggler killed in gunfight with police in Assam's Dhubri
151.article_body: A suspected cattle smuggler was killed in a gunfight with police in Assam's Dhubri district, officials said on Sunday. According to police, the deceased was shot in self-defence by officials, who were chasing the vehicle the former was travelling in the previous night. Over 40 people have been killed due to police action in state since May 2021, PTI reported.

152.title: People scream from their windows after a week of total lockdown in Shanghai
152.article_body: A video reportedly showing residents in China's Shanghai screaming from their balcony windows has gone viral online. The city of 26 million residents has been under total COVID-19 lockdown for a week and people aren't allowed to leave their homes even for essential supplies. Another video showed a drone appealing to people to 'control their soul's desire for freedom'.

153.title: I have craved for this day when I'm head down in work: Raj Arjun
153.article_body: Actor Raj Arjun has stated that he has craved the day when he is head down in work since his initial days. He added the rise of OTT has turned the tide in favour of artistes who fall back on their talent and grit. "Today, I am in a position where I can ask for a bound script," Raj said.

154.title: DC defend biggest total of IPL 2022 vs KKR as Kuldeep takes 4 wickets against his ex-team
154.article_body: DC defeated KKR by 44 runs to end their two-match losing streak and move to the sixth position on the IPL 2022 points table. DC put up the biggest total of IPL 2022 after scoring 215/5 in their 20 overs. DC spinner Kuldeep Yadav took four wickets against his former team as KKR were dismissed for 171 in 19.4 overs.

155.title: Sunak moves out of official UK residence amid row over Akshata's taxes: Reports
155.article_body: British Chancellor of the Exchequer Rishi Sunak has moved out of his Downing Street residence in London along with his family amid a row over his wife Akshata Murty's taxes, reports said on Sunday. Removal vans were reportedly spotted outside Sunak's Downing Street flat. Reports said the family will move into their newly-renovated luxury flat in Kensington.

156.title: Pro-Russian protests in Germany amid conflict in Ukraine
156.article_body: Pro-Russian protesters gathered in Germany on Sunday to protest against discrimination in the country towards Russians following the invasion of Ukraine. The protests included a 350-car motorcade, flying Russian and also a few German flags, in Hanover city. Around 2.35 lakh Russian citizens live in Germany, according to government statistics from late 2020.

157.title: Nitish Kumar will be CM till NDA govt exists in Bihar: JD(U) leader
157.article_body: Nitish Kumar will hold the post of Chief Minister of Bihar till the National Democratic Alliance (NDA) government remains in the state, Janata Dal (U) leader Upendra Kushwaha said on Sunday. He added that BJP was not pressurising Kumar to leave the post. "There is no dispute within JD(U) for the Chief Minister post in Bihar," Kushwaha said.

158.title: Have two pitches for Mahesh Babu: Filmmaker SS Rajamouli
158.article_body: Filmmaker SS Rajamouli, speaking about his upcoming project with actor Mahesh Babu, has said that he has two pitches for the actor. "When 'RRR' was postponed due to Omicron variant, my father Vijayendra Prasad, ordered me not to stay idle at home. We started dabbling with a couple of ideas," Rajamouli stated. "Both of them are exciting...large-scale movies," he added.

159.title: Driver falls from road roller, dies after coming under its wheels in UP
159.article_body: The driver of a road roller died after he fell from the vehicle and came under its rear wheel in Uttar Pradesh's Bhadohi on Saturday. The 40-year-old man lost control over the vehicle after a high-tension electric wire fell on it. He was working on a rural road project in the Gopiganj area of Bhadohi.

160.title: Russia seeking to recruit discharged soldiers amid Ukraine war: UK
160.article_body: UK's Defence Ministry claimed on Sunday that Russia is seeking to strengthen its troop numbers in Ukraine by recruiting military personnel who were discharged from services in 2012. Russia is also trying to employ soldiers from Transnistria, a breakaway region in Moldova, the ministry further claimed. This comes amid reports of Russia regrouping its troops in eastern Ukraine.

161.title: UK FM Sunak considered resigning over criticism of wife's tax status: Report
161.article_body: UK's Finance Minister Rishi Sunak considered whether he should resign after facing criticism over his wife Akshata Murty's non-domiciled tax status, The Sunday Times reported. "He was considering whether he could withstand his family taking this any more," the newspaper quoted a source as saying. Murty's non-domiciled tax status meant she didn't have to pay UK taxes on global earnings.

162.title: UK probes leak of Finance Minister Sunak's wife's tax affairs: Reports
162.article_body: The UK has reportedly launched a Whitehall inquiry into how the tax affairs of Finance Minister Rishi Sunak's wife Akshata Murty were leaked to the media. Sunak was recently criticised after it was revealed that Akshata holds a non-domiciled status in the UK. Following the row, Akshata said that she will start paying UK taxes on her overseas income.

163.title: New Pak govt will not indulge in politics of revenge: Shehbaz Sharif
163.article_body: Shehbaz Sharif, who has been nominated as the next PM of Pakistan, on Sunday claimed that the new government in the country will not indulge in politics of revenge. "I don't want to go back to bitterness of...past. We want to forget them and move forward," he said. Earlier, Imran Khan had lost the no-trust vote in the National Assembly.

164.title: LSG to bowl first against RR, both teams make two changes
164.article_body: LSG won the toss and elected to bowl first against RR in their IPL 2022 clash. LSG have made two changes to their playing XI, with Marcus Stoinis and Dushmantha Chameera replacing Evin Lewis and Andrew Tye, respectively. RR have also made two changes, with Rassie van der Dussen and Kuldeep Sen replacing Yashasvi Jaiswal and Navdeep Saini, respectively.

165.title: Each of 403 Assembly segments in UP to have 100-bed hospitals: Yogi
165.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath on Sunday inaugurated a statewide health campaign and said that each of the 403 Assembly segments in UP will have a 100-bed hospital. "Encephalitis came under control in the past four years. The deadly encephalitis will be eradicated forever in one to two years," Yogi said while launching the Jan Arogya Mela in UP.

166.title: My wife Maanayata pushed me to do 'K.G.F: Chapter 2': Sanjay Dutt
166.article_body: Actor Sanjay Dutt has revealed that his wife Maanayata Dutt pushed him to do the upcoming film 'K.G.F: Chapter 2'. The actor further said that the journey of the film has been a lesson for him after 45 years. "This film was made as a family," he added. This is Sanjay's first film since his recovery from lung cancer.

167.title: Japan & Philippines agree to enhance defence cooperation at 2+2 meeting
167.article_body: Japan and the Philippines agreed to enhance their defence cooperation at the countries' first-ever 2+2 meeting in Tokyo on Saturday. The countries affirmed their commitment to ensuring a "free and open Indo-Pacific" region, according to a statement released by Japan's Foreign Ministry. Notably, the countries have maritime disputes with China in the East and South China seas.

168.title: EV retail sales witness three-fold jump in FY22: Industry body
168.article_body: Federation of Automobile Dealers Association (FADA) said electric vehicle (EV) retail sales in India witnessed a three-fold jump YoY from 1,34,821 units sold in FY21 to 4,29,217 units sold in FY22. "Total EV sales had stood at 1,68,300 units in FY20," it further said. Tata Motors led the segment with 15,198 units sold and a market share of 85.37%.

169.title: Wish I could tell myself at 23 not to be impulsive: Raveena
169.article_body: Actress Raveena Tandon has stated that when she was 23 years old, she was a grounded person but super sensitive and a bit impulsive. "I wish I could tell myself then that work in time heals everything and tell myself not to be impulsive," she added. The actress further said she had to deal with yellow journalism at the time.

170.title: 27-yr-old Pune woman harassed over extra marital affair dies by suicide
170.article_body: A 27-year-old woman in Pune died by suicide after allegedly being harassed by her husband and in-laws for being involved in an extra-marital affair, police said. Investigating Officer API Manohar Sonwane said that the accused have been arrested for harassing her mentally and physically, which led the victim to take the extreme step.

171.title: AAP leader attacked with chopper by 3 minors in Pune
171.article_body: President of Aam Aadmi Party's social justice wing in Pimpri Chinchwad, Yashwant Shrimant Kamble was allegedly attacked with a chopper by three minors when he was returning home from a protest on Saturday. Kamble was returning on his two-wheeler when motorcycle-borne attackers came from behind and hit him with a sharp weapon believed to be a chopper, reports said.

172.title: UK PM travels in train to reach war-hit Ukraine; video of train surfaces
172.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson travelled on a train from Poland to Ukraine to meet the war-hit country's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy recently. In a clip shared by the Ukrainian Railways online, the UK PM said, "I am travelling on a fantastic train through to Kyiv from Poland." On meeting Zelenskyy, Johnson said, "Ukrainians have shown the courage of a lion."

173.title: Chris Rock jokes about Will Smith's Oscars slap, says 'got my hearing back'
173.article_body: Comedian Chris Rock joked about actor Will Smith slapping him at the 94th Academy Awards during a recent standup show. "I'm okay...I'm not talking about [the slapping incident] until I get paid. Life is good. I got my hearing back," Chris joked. This comes after Will received a 10-year ban from attending the Oscars because of the incident.

174.title: Protest outside Sri Lankan Prez's office continues for 2nd day
174.article_body: Sri Lankan protesters continued to occupy the entrance of President Gotabaya Rajapaksa's office for a second day on Sunday amid a severe economic crisis in the country. The crisis has led to a shortage of essential items in Sri Lanka. "We will stay on, we will leave only when we have chased them out," a 32-year-old former soldier said.

175.title: Thane woman killed, 2 injured as portion of adjoining house collapses
175.article_body: A 45-year-old woman was killed and two other persons were injured after the balcony of an adjacent house collapsed on their residence in the Thane district of Maharashtra on Sunday, officials said. The injured persons were taken to a local hospital, from where they were shifted to Mumbai for further treatment. One of the injured persons is aged 45.

176.title: Qutub Minar was built after demolishing 27 Hindu-Jain temples: VHP
