176.article_body: Vishva Hindu Parishad Spokesman Vinod Bansal on Sunday said Qutub Minar was built "with material obtained after demolishing 27 Hindu-Jain temples". "Qutub Minar was actually 'Vishnu Stambh'...The superimposed structure was built just to tease the Hindu community," Bansal added. He also demanded that the 27 demolished temples be rebuilt and Hindus be allowed to offer prayers there.

177.title: 12 crude bombs used for killing pigs found in a field in Pune
177.article_body: Pune's Dighi Police recovered 12 crude bombs, used to kill pigs and stray animals, popularly known as dukkar (pig bombs), from Wadmukhwadi on Friday. According to the police, the bombs were spotted by a woman, whose five-year-old daughter was killed by the same explosives in February, when the child tried to play with it, not knowing it was a bomb.

178.title: Pics show Kapoors' bungalow being lit up ahead of Ranbir, Alia's rumoured wedding
178.article_body: Pictures have shown lights being put up at a bungalow belonging to actor Ranbir Kapoor's family, ahead of his rumoured wedding with Alia Bhatt on April 17. Visuals showed Krishna Raj Bungalow being lit up, even as reports said that some wedding rituals will be performed there. The couple will reportedly move into the bungalow after their wedding.

179.title: NCB busts illegal drug supply chain in Kolkata, arrests 4 people
179.article_body: Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) busted an illegal drug supply chain in Kolkata and arrested four people on Friday. NCB raided a godown of accused, identified as Minagur Rahaman, who is allegedly involved in retail sale of psychotropic substances, and recovered injections, cough syrups and capsules. One of the seized drugs is used to treat addiction to opioids, NCB added.

180.title: Delhi govt’s parent outreach programme yet to cover 250 schools
180.article_body: A report on the Delhi government's parent outreach programme launched last year found that it is yet to cover 250 schools. A report submitted by the Delhi Commission for Protection of Child Rights said that out of the 1,068 government schools, School Management Committee (SMC) members and school mitras had done no interactions with parents in 250 schools.

181.title: K'taka govt hands over probe into B'luru road rage killing to CID
181.article_body: The Karnataka government has handed over the probe into the road rage incident, in which a 22-year-old man was killed in Bengaluru to CID, state Home Minister Araga Jnanendra said. "I have instructed higher officials of the police department. Our officials have collected evidence," he added. The victim was stabbed to death by three men in JJ Nagar on Tuesday.

182.title: Sony TV's Kaun Banega Crorepati registrations are now open
182.article_body: Sony Entertainment Television has opened online registrations for the upcoming fourteenth season of Kaun Banega Crorepati. Starting April 9, host Mr. Amitabh Bachchan will ask a new question everyday at 9pm, giving aspirants a chance to be India's next crorepati with the power of their knowledge, Sony Entertainment Television announced.

183.title: Delhi Capitals record highest total of IPL 2022
183.article_body: Delhi Capitals (DC) put up a total of 215/5 against Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) on Sunday to record the highest total of IPL 2022 so far and their fourth highest total in IPL history. It is the eighth time that DC have scored more than 200 runs in an innings in IPL. DC slammed 11 sixes in their innings today.

184.title: Coinbase suspends UPI payments option in India days after launch
184.article_body: US-based crypto exchange Coinbase has disabled the option to buy cryptocurrencies using UPI method in India. The development comes days after Coinbase launched its trading services in India and said it would allow users to buy crypto using UPI. After the launch, the National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) had clarified it wasn't aware of any crypto exchange using UPI.

185.title: India's 5th richest man Damani reduces Blue Dart stake, hikes stake in VST: Report
185.article_body: Radhakishan Damani, DMart owner and India's fifth-richest person with a net worth of $20 billion according to Forbes, has increased his shareholding in Hyderabad-based cigarettes company VST Industries, The Economic Times reported. He bought 12,000 equity shares of VST Industries during the January-March period. He decreased in logistics company Blue Dart Express in the March 2022 quarter.

186.title: Russian helicopters destroy Ukrainian military convoy: Report
186.article_body: A convoy of Ukrainian military vehicles was destroyed by Russian attack helicopters, a news agency reported on Sunday, citing Russia's Defence Ministry. Videos published by the ministry showed helicopters flying at low altitude, launching missiles and firing from guns at ground targets. However, the location and the timing of the attack was not specified.

187.title: NC will welcome those who want to strengthen pluralistic J&K: Farooq
187.article_body: National Conference (NC) chief Farooq Abdullah said on Saturday that party will welcome those who want to strengthen the idea of a united, democratic and pluralistic Jammu and Kashmir. Abdullah added that NC's vision is to protect the social, cultural and political interests of people from all regions and religions. He made the remarks at a party event in Jammu.

188.title: Revamped bus stop inaugurated in Mumbai; 105 more to come up soon
188.article_body: Maharashtra Minister Aaditya Thackeray on Sunday inaugurated the revamped bus stop of Famous Studio in Mumbai's Worli and promised such "sleek bus stops in another 105 locations" across Mumbai. He also inaugurated the revamped Shri Shantinath Chowk and Late Smt Sunita Dattaji Nalawade Manoranjan Maidan. These projects are part of Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation's Tactical Urbanism Initiative.

189.title: Did 1 scene with Rishi Kapoor, wasn't starstruck but excited: Isha
189.article_body: Actress Isha Talwar has stated that she did one scene with late veteran actor Rishi Kapoor in the film 'Sharmaji Namkeen'. "I was there when he was shooting his other scenes and I was doing something else on those days," she added. Isha further said that she grew up watching him act and dance and she wasn't starstruck but excited.

190.title: Freedom struggle begins again: Imran Khan after being removed as Pak PM
190.article_body: Ousted Pakistan PM Imran Khan on Sunday made his first remarks after losing a no-confidence motion against him in the country's Parliament. "Pakistan became an independent state in 1947, but the freedom struggle begins again today against a foreign conspiracy of regime change," tweeted Khan. "It's always the people of the country who defend their sovereignty and democracy," he added.

191.title: Have chances to win championship: Ferrari's Leclerc after Aus GP win
191.article_body: After winning the 2022 F1 Australian Grand Prix, Ferrari's driver Charles Leclerc has said that his team "have chances" to win the championship. "Obviously, we're only at the third race so it's difficult to think about the championship, but...we've got a very strong car," he stated. The last time Ferrari won the championship was back in 2007 with Kimi Räikkönen.

192.title: Very good player for future: Plessis after Anuj Rawat's 66(47) vs MI
192.article_body: RCB skipper Faf du Plessis has praised opener Anuj Rawat after his 47-ball 66 in RCB's seven-wicket win over Mumbai Indians in IPL 2022. "Anuj has potential...Comes down the wicket, shows intent, he's a very good player for the future," Du Plessis stated. In the ongoing tournament, the 22-year-old has scored 113 runs in four innings so far.

193.title: Dulquer's next film with Mrunal, Rashmika titled 'Sita Ramam'
193.article_body: Director Hanu Raghavapudi and his production team announced the title of their next film on the occasion of Ram Navami on Sunday. The film, titled 'Sita Ramam', stars Dulquer Salmaan, Rashmika Mandanna and Mrunal Thakur. The makers also shared a glimpse of the upcoming project, which revolves around the characters of Dulquer and Mrunal, who play Ram and Sita, respectively.

194.title: MI came back from behind to win IPL 2015, but that team was different: Irfan
194.article_body: Following Mumbai Indians' four consecutive defeats in IPL 2022, ex-India all-rounder Irfan Pathan recalled MI's IPL 2015 campaign where the team lost their first four matches, but still managed to lift the trophy. "In IPL 2015, they were in...similar situation...but that team was a little different," Irfan stated. Mumbai are yet to win a match in the ongoing tournament.

195.title: Fielding is where game vs KKR will be won or lost: DC's David Warner
195.article_body: David Warner said Delhi Capitals will be looking to "outfield" Kolkata Knight Riders in the IPL 2022 match on Sunday. "Fielding is...big component...that's where...game will be won or lost," Warner stated. DC have won one out of their three matches in the tournament so far. "We can't afford to get too far behind in terms of wins," he added.

196.title: FPIs invest ₹7,707 cr in April after 6-month-long selling streak
196.article_body: Foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) turned net buyers between April 1-8 and invested ₹7,707 crore in Indian equities after a six-month-long selling streak. FPIs put in ₹1,403 crore in the debt markets in the period under review after pulling out net ₹8,705 crore in February and March 2022. Between October 2021 and March 2022, FPIs withdrew net ₹1.48 lakh crore.

197.title: We're like Lagaan team, intention was to win: Yash on KGF's success
197.article_body: 'K.G.F: Chapter 2' actor Yash, speaking about the film series' success, has said that they are like the team in 2001 film 'Lagaan' as their intention was to come and win. He added that they didn't have many resources but pushed his director's work. "I had to convince him to take KGF to India and...we went full out," Yash said.

198.title: Several people join Ram Navami procession in B'luru; video surfaces
198.article_body: Several people joined the Ram Navami procession which was taken out in the Padmanabhanagar area of Bengaluru on Sunday. A video shows people chanting slogans of 'Jai Shri Ram' while taking part in the procession. BJP MP from Bengaluru South Tejasvi Surya and Karnataka Minister R Ashoka also joined the procession.

199.title: 2 terrorists linked to attack on CRPF troops, shot dead in Srinagar
199.article_body: Two terrorists, linked to a recent attack on the CRPF troops, were shot dead in Srinagar on Sunday, tweeted the Kashmir Zone Police. "They belonged to Pakistan and were from Lashkar-e-Taiba. Both were gunned down. Our personnel have become a soft target for terrorists. Militancy is declining and we'll ensure it dwindles further," said IGP (Kashmir) Vijay Kumar.

200.title: NGT forms panel to probe encroachment of wetlands in GB Nagar
200.article_body: The National Green Tribunal (NGT) has ordered the setting up of a joint committee of UP officials to file a report on alleged encroachment of 117 water bodies and wetlands in Gautam Buddha Nagar. The committee has been asked to submit the report in two months. The committee has been also asked to mention the measures taken for their protection.

201.title: American skater Alysa Liu retires aged 16, says 'It has been an insane 11 years'
201.article_body: World Championships bronze medallist figure skater Alysa Liu of the US has announced her retirement aged 16. "I started skating when I was five so that's about 11 years on the ice and it's been an insane 11 years," she wrote on Instagram. "I feel so satisfied with how my skating career has gone," the two-time US national champion added.

202.title: Janhvi Kapoor, Varun Dhawan's 'Bawaal' goes on floors in Lucknow
202.article_body: The shooting of Varun Dhawan and Janhvi Kapoor-starrer 'Bawaal' has begun on Sunday. Director Nitesh Tiwari's wife Ashwiny Iyer took to her Instagram handle to announce the commencement of the shoot. Reportedly, In India, the filming is scheduled to happen in three different locations. Apart from India, the shooting of 'Bawaal' will take place in four European places including Paris.

203.title: BJP to fight Himachal elections under CM Thakur's leadership: Nadda
203.article_body: BJP President JP Nadda has said that the party will contest this year's Himachal Pradesh Assembly elections under CM Jai Ram Thakur's leadership. "He (Thakur) will not be replaced and the BJP will contest the Assembly elections under his leadership," Nadda said. "10-15% BJP MLAs did not get tickets in UP...and it is likely to happen here too," he added.

204.title: Gotabaya govt to blame for Sri Lanka's economic crisis: Ex-PM
204.article_body: Ex-Sri Lankan PM Ranil Wickremesinghe on Sunday accused incumbent administration of being responsible for Sri Lanka's economic crisis due to its "incompetence", adding that people want President Gotabaya Rajapaksa to resign. "When I left the office in 2019, we had a surplus budget," he added. Sri Lanka is experiencing a shortage of essential items, including food supplies, medicines and fuel.

205.title: 'Star Trek', 'As The World Turns' actress Kathryn Hays passes away at 87
205.article_body: Veteran American actress Kathryn Hays, known for her pivotal roles in 'Star Trek' and 'As The World Turns', has passed away at the age of 87. According to Deadline, she died on March 25 in Fairfield, Connecticut. Kathryn Hays is survived by her daughter and son-in-law, three grandchildren, and a great-grandson, as per Deadline.

206.title: Is that a punishment: Colin Jost on Will Smith's 10 year Oscar ban
206.article_body: After Will Smith was banned from attending Academy events for 10 years, Colin Jost joked about The Academy's decision stating that the ban wasn't the best way to punish him. He said, "Is that a punishment? He can still be nominated...He just doesn't have to attend the four-hour ceremony where someone is...going to make fun of his wife again."

207.title: Ferrari driver Charles Leclerc wins Australian Grand Prix
207.article_body: Ferrari's Charles Leclerc claimed his second win in the ongoing Formula One season by winning the Australian Grand Prix on Sunday. The Monaco-born racer secured his fourth career win by more than 20 seconds ahead of the runner-up Sergio Perez. Red Bull's Max Verstappen had to retire mid-way after his car started having some technical problems.

208.title: Elon Musk is now $100 billion richer than Jeff Bezos: Forbes
208.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk is now nearly $100 billion richer than Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos, according to Forbes' Real-Time Billionaires List. Musk's net worth is now pegged at $282 billion while Bezos' net worth is at $183.6 billion. Musk, who started with a net worth of $26.6 billion in 2020, saw his wealth soar during the COVID-19 pandemic.

209.title: Strange cloud formation appears over mountain in US, locals share pics
209.article_body: Locals in US' Alaska shared pictures of a strange cloud-like formation that appeared above the Lazy Mountain, prompting a police investigation into its origin. After theories suspecting a UFO crash or a Russian weapon surfaced online, the Alaska State Troopers issued a statement, saying, "A contrail from a commercial jet combined with the rising sun...caused the unique atmospheric sight."

210.title: I've never yelled like that in my life: Shastri recalls scolding MSD for playing football
210.article_body: Ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri recalled scolding MS Dhoni for playing football ahead of an Asia Cup final match. "There was dew...he went skidding five minutes before the toss. I've never yelled like that in my life. I said, 'Stop the game!'" Shastri said. "He loves it...The intensity with which he plays football scares you from the outside," he stated.

211.title: 'Everyone loves Deepika' dialogue wasn't improvised; it was in script: Abhishek
211.article_body: On 'The Kapil Sharma Show', comedian-host Kapil Sharma asked Abhishek Bachchan about the dialogue 'Everyone loves Deepika' and questioned, "Was this dialogue a part of...[Dasvi] script or did you improvise it?" To which Abhishek replied, "No, no, it was there in the script. Otherwise, I would've taken the name of someone else. After all, I've to go back home."

212.title: Why administer booster dose only through pvt hospitals: Congress
212.article_body: Congress spokesperson Abhishek Singhvi has criticised the BJP-led Centre for not allowing government hospitals to administer COVID-19 vaccine booster dose. "Why administer this booster dose only through private hospitals and have no option of getting it through government hospitals. Does it make sense?," asked Singhvi. He further accused this policy of being "discriminatory" towards poor people.

213.title: Entire European project is Russia's target: Ukraine Prez Zelenskyy
213.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Saturday said that Russia's aggression is not limited to Ukraine but that the "entire European project" is Russia's target. He added that this is why everyone must support Ukraine as it's "a strategy of defence for every civilized state". Russia's use of force is "a catastrophe that will inevitably hit everyone", he further said.

214.title: Pune's atheist meet may disturb law & order on Ram Navami; postponed
214.article_body: An atheist conference scheduled in Pune on Sunday has been postponed, as the city police feared that "organising the event on the day of Ram Navami festival could cause law and order problems," organisers said. An organiser, Dr Nitin Hande said, "The police also said some Hindutvawadi outfits have taken objection to the event."

215.title: Ayesha Takia's husband alleges racism at Goa airport, says 'officer tried to touch wife'
215.article_body: Actress Ayesha Takia Azmi's husband Abu Farhan Azmi alleged CISF officers of racism after calling his name "out loud" at Goa airport. "Altercation started when an armed male officer...tried to physically touch & tell my wife, son to stand in another line," he tweeted. He also alleged that a guard "made a dirty sexual comment" while checking his pockets.

216.title: Not scared of any ban: Cong leader who questioned Irani on petrol prices in flight
216.article_body: Netta D'Souza, the Acting President of All India Mahila Congress who questioned Union Minister Smriti Irani on a flight about increasing petrol and LPG prices, tweeted, "Not scared of any ban. I'll keep showing Mirror of Truth to Modi Govt & its Ministers!" D'Souza was responding to a Twitter user who said she could be handed a six-month flight ban.

217.title: Need to close situations: Zaheer Khan after MI's loss against RCB
217.article_body: After Mumbai Indians suffered their fourth straight loss in IPL 2022, team director Zaheer Khan said that the franchise needs to close situations when the momentum begins to shift away. "You’ve got to be able to close those moments of the game...We’ve...not been able to do that... It’s a long season, need to keep things tight," Zaheer said.

218.title: Deepika shares poem she wrote in class 7, says it was her 'first & last' attempt
218.article_body: Deepika Padukone took to Instagram on Sunday to share a poem that she wrote in her childhood. The actress mentioned that it was her "first and [the] last attempt at writing poetry". "This was in grade 7. I was 12. The poem was titled 'I Am'. We were given...first 2 words that you see...and the rest is history," Deepika wrote.

219.title: Happy to have Faf as opening partner: RCB batter Anuj Rawat
219.article_body: RCB opener Anuj Rawat has said that he is "really happy" that captain Faf Du Plessis is his opening partner. "It feels great to be a part of RCB. Opening with Faf and having players like Virat...it’s a great feeling for me," Rawat said. "Finally...I was having the same mindset as (that of) previous games," he added.

220.title: Ayush Badoni has all qualities of a future star: Harbhajan
220.article_body: Former India cricketer Harbhajan Singh has said that he believes the Lucknow Super Giants' 22-year-old batter Ayush Badoni has the qualities of becoming a "future star". "Badoni is a very confident player...(don't) get the feeling that this is his debut season. He has this quality to absorb pressure which is a sign of...a future star," Harbhajan said.

221.title: Plea in Pak court to stop ex-PM Imran Khan from leaving country
221.article_body: The Islamabad High Court will hear a plea seeking to prevent former PM Imran Khan and some ministers of the erstwhile government from leaving the country, according to reports. The petition demands Khan, former ministers Shah Mahmood Qureshi and Fawad Chaudhry to be put on the exit control list. This comes after Khan lost no-confidence motion in the National Assembly.

222.title: Bryan, Aaron to reprise 'Breaking Bad' roles in 'Better Call Saul' final season
222.article_body: 'Breaking Bad' actors Bryan Cranston and Aaron Paul are set to return as Walter White and Jesse Pinkman in the final season of spin-off series 'Better Call Saul'. Confirming the news, the show's Twitter account shared a picture of Bryan and Aaron with a message that read, "They're coming back." Bob Odenkirk plays the lead role in 'Better Call Saul'.

223.title: Woman charged with murder in US' Texas for abortion; protest held
223.article_body: A protest was held outside a sheriff's office in US' Texas over a 26-year-old woman being allegedly charged with murder after authorities said she had caused the "the death of an individual by self-induced abortion". In Texas, abortions are banned as early as six weeks. Lizelle Herrera was arrested on Thursday with a bond set at $500,000 (nearly ₹3.8 crore).

224.title: Deeply disappointed in Putin, he seemed to be man of peace: Ex-Italy PM
224.article_body: Ex-Italian PM Silvio Berlusconi has said that he's deeply disappointed in Russian President Vladimir Putin amid ongoing Ukraine war, adding that Putin had seemed to be "man of democracy and peace” to him. "The...Ukraine [war], instead of bringing Russia into Europe has thrown it into...arms of China," Berlusconi added. Berlusconi had termed Putin "number one among world leaders" in 2015.

225.title: COVID-19 is a 'bahurupiya' disease, never know when it'll resurface: PM Modi
225.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Sunday urged people not to let their guards down in the battle against COVID-19 and called it a 'bahurupiya' (form-changing) disease. "Coronavirus was a big crisis and we aren't saying that [it's] over," PM said at a virtual event. He added, "It may have taken a pause, but we never know when it will resurface."

226.title: Dylan wishes fiancée Kristen on b'day, says 'Time looks good on you'
226.article_body: Actress Kristen Stewart celebrated her 32nd birthday with her fiancée Dylan Meyer. Taking to Instagram, Dylan shared a post with Kristen with a picture where they are seen leaning in for a kiss over a birthday cake. She captioned the post, "Another one around the sun and you're out here getting flyer every year. Time looks good on you."

227.title: Important to fight together as BJP trying to weaken Opp'n: Kharge
227.article_body: Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge on Sunday said the Opposition must "fight together...[as BJP-RSS] are trying to see to it that only one party remains". Reacting to BSP chief Mayawati's comments that Congress should worry about itself, Kharge said, "Congress has always been with people." He asserted that Congress had indeed invited Mayawati to lead the anti-BJP alliance in Uttar Pradesh.

228.title: Brie Larson joins 'Fast & Furious 10', Vin says 'Welcome to the family'
228.article_body: Brie Larson, who plays Captain Marvel in the Marvel Cinematic Universe, has joined the cast of 'Fast & Furious 10'. Actor Vin Diesel took to Instagram on Sunday to share the news. "You have no idea how timeless and amazing she will be in our mythology...Welcome to the FAMILY Brie," he wrote. The upcoming instalment will also feature Jason Momoa.

229.title: Ghaziabad completes 100% 1st dose vaccination for those aged 15-18
229.article_body: Ghaziabad district has completed administering the first dose of COVID-19 vaccination to 100% of those in 15-18 age group. "There were delays in completing...first dose target as many children didn't turn up," a senior official said. "We've to keep in mind that their annual school examinations are nearing and that is why there was a little delay," the official added.

230.title: Rajasthan man shoots woman dead for refusing to marry him; later kills self
230.article_body: A 30-year-old killed himself after shooting a woman dead as she had refused to marry him in Rajasthan's Jodhpur. Both the deceased knew each other for the last five years. As per preliminary investigation, the man, who was married and had two children, wanted to marry the woman and also suspected her of having an affair with another man.

231.title: Fire breaks out at banquet hall in Delhi, no casualty reported
231.article_body: A fire broke out at a banquet hall near the Peeragarhi Chowk in Delhi on Sunday morning, officials said. They added that no casualty was reported in the incident. The fire services department received a call about the incident at 11 am and seven fire-tenders were sent to the spot, Delhi Fire Services Director Atul Garg said.

232.title: Noida Authority successfully carries out test blast at Supertech twin towers
232.article_body: A test blast to demolish the illegally-built Supertech twin towers in Noida was successfully carried out around 2.30 pm on Sunday. Edifice Engineering and Jet Demolition were roped in by Noida Authority for this purpose. The test blast was carried out to ascertain the amount of explosives needed for the towers' actual demolition, which will take place on May 22.

233.title: Smugglers throw cows from truck during high-speed police chase in Gurugram
233.article_body: A video has surfaced of a high-speed police chase of cattle smugglers, in which cows are seen being thrown out of their truck by the smugglers. The 22-km-long chase took place in Gurugram's Cyber City area early on Saturday and the accused reportedly drove the truck with deflated tires. Five people were arrested at the end of the chase.

234.title: There's some extra love in the air: Ayan on Alia & Ranbir's Brahmāstra poster
234.article_body: Amid Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt's wedding reports, the couple's close friend and filmmaker Ayan Mukerji dropped a new poster of Brahmāstra. Sharing the poster featuring Alia and Ranbir together, Ayan wrote, "Brahmāstra is about the Energy of Love. A love, that spreads like fire...The time feels right for it...There is some extra love in the air these days!"

235.title: Delhi Police arrests 76, recover 1.4 kg of ganja in last 24 hrs
235.article_body: Delhi Police arrested 76 persons for robbery, snatching, liquor smuggling and recovered 1.425 kilograms of ganja in the last 24 hours, according to data released by their official Twitter account. Moreover, Delhi Police arrested 17 proclaimed offenders, seized 979 quarters of illicit liquor and recovered 11 stolen vehicles. Emergency help was given on 4,829 calls, the post added.

236.title: First round of presidential elections underway in France
236.article_body: Voting for the first round of presidential elections started on Sunday. Around 4.8 crore citizens are eligible to vote in the contest between 12 candidates, including the incumbent President Emmanuel Macron and prominent leaders like Marine Le Pen and Jean-Luc Melenchon. If no candidate manages to get over 50% votes, a second round will be held between the top two.

237.title: 9-year-old girl writes letter to mother killed in Ukraine, says 'I'll never forget you'
237.article_body: A nine-year-old girl has written a letter to her mother who was killed in Russia's war in Ukraine, saying "I'll never forget you." She added, "I'll do my best to be a good person and get in heaven too. See you in heaven!" The letter was shared by Anton Gerashchenko, an adviser to the Minister of Internal Affairs of Ukraine.

238.title: Congress leader questions Smriti Irani on rising petrol, LPG prices in flight
238.article_body: Netta D'Souza, the Acting President of All India Mahila Congress, questioned Union Minister Smriti Irani on a flight about increasing prices of petrol and LPG. Irani initially said that D'Souza was "blocking the way", and when the minister was asked about "stoves without gas", she said, "please don't lie". Recently, petrol prices were hiked 14 times in 16 days.

239.title: I wish somebody was there to guide me: Taha Shah Badussha
239.article_body: Actor Taha Shah Badussha, who made his debut in 2011 film 'Luv Ka The End', has said that he joined the industry when he was 20 but wishes he could when he was 14. "Looking back, I believe everything that happened was to make me stronger. I also wish somebody was there to guide me," the actor added.

240.title: Hyderabad man posts morphed photos of woman online, arrested
240.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police have arrested a man for allegedly harassing a woman by posting morphed photos of her across social media platforms. The 28-year-old accused, who took screenshots from video calls between him and the woman, posted photos after victim refused to engage in further conversations with him. According to police, accused also sent the same photos to victim's husband.

241.title: No FBI team is in India to probe Karnataka Bitcoin scam case: CBI
241.article_body: The CBI said the US' Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) has not sent any team to India to conduct a probe into an alleged Bitcoin scam case that is being investigated by Karnataka Police. Several Congress leaders earlier claimed the FBI is in India to investigate the Bitcoin scam, which the party alleged the Karnataka BJP government had covered up.

242.title: New Delhi civic body starts 'Suvidha Camp' for grievance redressal
242.article_body: The New Delhi Municipal Council (NDMC) on Saturday began a two-week 'Suvidha Camp' at its Convention Centre on Jai Singh Road. The NDMC received 114 grievances on the first day of the camp, according to officials. "All grievances were discussed face-to-face between the public and the concerned officials of the NDMC departments for expeditious resolutions," an official said.

243.title: Don't try to break homes: Prakash Raj on Amit Shah's Hindi remark
243.article_body: Actor-politician Prakash Raj on Friday tweeted, "Don't try to break homes, Mr Home Minister. We dare you #stopHindiImposition. We love our diversity, we love our mother tongue, we love our identities." His tweet comes after Union Home Minister Amit Shah's statement that people of different states should communicate with each other in Hindi and not English.

244.title: SP not working for Muslims, alleges party's Lok Sabha MP Barq
244.article_body: Samajwadi Party MP Shafiqur Rahman Barq has accused his own party of not "working for Muslims". "I am not satisfied with the working, the entire Samajwadi is not working for Muslims," the Lok Sabha MP said after he voted for the UP Legislative Council elections on Saturday. He also accused the Yogi Adityanath-led government of not "doing justice with Muslims".

245.title: Table-toppers KKR to bowl first against seventh-placed DC, playing XIs announced
245.article_body: Table-toppers KKR won the toss and elected to bowl first against seventh-placed DC in their IPL 2022 clash in Mumbai on Sunday. KKR, who have won two matches in a row, are playing with an unchanged side. DC, who have lost two matches in a row, have made one change to their playing XI, with Khaleel Ahmed replacing Anrich Nortje.

246.title: U'khand CM performs 'kanya poojan' at Dehradun house; pics surface
246.article_body: Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami on Sunday performed 'kanya poojan' at his residence in Dehradun on the occasion of Ram Navami. He also shared pictures of the event, saying, "I pray that the blessings of Maa Durga always remain on all of us." On Ram Navami, the ninth day of Chaitra Navaratri, nine girls representing Goddess Durga's avatars are worshipped.

247.title: KKR's ₹8-cr buy Nitish Rana needs to show more responsibility: Aakash
247.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Aakash Chopra has said that KKR batter Nitish Rana needs to show "more responsibility" in the ongoing IPL 2022. "Nitish has been purchased for ₹8 crore...He is not doing the job yet," Aakash stated. The 28-year-old, who was KKR's third-highest run-scorer in IPL 2021, has scored 39 runs in four innings in IPL 2022 so far, averaging 9.75.

248.title: Language chauvinism will boomerang: KTR on Amit Shah's Hindi remark
248.article_body: Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao on Sunday criticised Union Home Minister Amit Shah's remark that people of different states should communicate with each other in Hindi and not English. Rao said, "Language chauvinism/hegemony will boomerang." He asked, "Why don't we let people of our great nation decide what to eat, what to wear, who to pray to...what language to speak!"

249.title: Hyd Police bust IPL betting racket, seize materials worth ₹1.20 crore
249.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police on Saturday arrested five persons from the city's Vanasthalipuram area for being allegedly involved in an IPL betting racket. Police also seized cash and other items worth ₹1.20 crore from accused's possession. One of the accused had opened two current bank accounts in the name of two trading entities to run racket and mislead authorities, police said.

250.title: Woman shares pics of 14-yr-old son's bruised hand, smashed phone after Ronaldo's outburst
250.article_body: After Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo smashed the phone out of a boy's hand in frustration after 0-1 loss against Everton, the mother of the boy shared pictures of his bruised hand and smashed phone. The woman revealed that her 14-year-old son was in complete shock and couldn't digest what happened as he is autistic and has got dyspraxia.

251.title: Police constable harasses woman officer over WhatsApp in Mumbai; booked
251.article_body: A police constable has been booked for allegedly harassing a woman police officer over WhatsApp and stalking her in Mumbai. The Khar Police said a case has been registered against him under relevant sections of the Indian Penal Code and the IT Act. The constable has not been arrested yet, the Khar Police added.

252.title: We need 1% increase of rates: Kotak as RBI raises inflation forecast to 5.7%
252.article_body: Kotak Mahindra Bank's CEO Uday Kotak questioned the RBI's decision to raise retail inflation projection and keep repo rates unchanged. "RBI policy: Sharp increase in inflation estimate to 5.7%...Present repo rate at 4%," Kotak tweeted. "If India has to move to 0% real rate that is, inflation - interest rate = 0, we need 1% increase of rates," he added.

253.title: BharatPe has put the Ashneer row behind & posted record growth: CEO
253.article_body: BharatPe posted record growth in FY22, is on track to break even and list on stock exchanges in the next 18-24 months after putting behind the controversy around Co-founder Ashneer Grover, CEO Suhail Sameer said. He added that his priority is BharatPe's employees so that they stay focused. "Business in Q4 FY22 is up 20% on every metric," Sameer said.

254.title: How did a gang steal a 60-feet bridge in Bihar?
254.article_body: A gang dismantled a 60-feet iron bridge in Bihar and likely sold it in parts as scrap metal. The robbers, posing as government officials with the irrigation department, "came with heavy machinery, gas cutters and worked for two days during daytime to dismantle the bridge," Reuters quoted a villager. The bridge was built over a water canal three decades ago.

255.title: Had an affair with a director; even got pregnant: Lock Upp contestant Mandana
255.article_body:
'Lock Upp' contestant Mandana Karimi spoke about the time she was going through a separation from her husband and revealed that she had a secret affair with a filmmaker at that point. "My relationship was with a...director who talks about women's rights," she said. "We 
 planned...pregnancy," Mandana revealed in the promo, which ended with shots of those around her crying.

256.title: 'Adipurush' director shares fan-made posters showing Prabhas' look as Lord Ram
256.article_body: On the occasion of Ram Navami, 'Adipurush' director Om Raut took to Twitter and shared some fan-made posters showing Prabhas' look as Lord Ram. "Celebrating the victory of good over evil #ramnavami," he wrote. The film, an adaptation of 'Ramayana', will feature Prabhas as Lord Ram and Saif Ali Khan as Lankesh. It also stars Kriti Sanon and Sunny Singh.

257.title: Supriya Sule to inaugurate Symbiosis elderly care centre in Pune on Apr 12
257.article_body: Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) MP Supriya Sule will inaugurate the Symbiosis Centre for Geriatric Care in Pune on April 12. Several senior citizen clubs, 'Hasya Yoga' groups and those running old-age homes will be felicitated at the event. A senior doctor said that all the services will be provided within a well-confined area to ensure accessibility at the centre.

258.title: BMC to install rooftop solar panels on toilet blocks in Goregaon
258.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has decided to install rooftop solar panels on street toilet blocks in Mumbai's Goregaon area. A BMC official said that the initiative is being carried out to utilise space and clean energy. "The rooftops of toilet blocks have little use...Most land ends up becoming storage space or has no use at all," the official said.

259.title: Palestinians set fire to West Bank shrine: Israeli military
259.article_body: The Israeli military on Sunday claimed that about 100 Palestinians marched towards a West Bank shrine and set it on fire. This comes amid the escalating tension between Israel and Palestine during the holy month of Ramzan. "The vandalism of Joseph's Tomb is a grave event and a serious violation of freedom of worship," said Israel's Defence Minister.

260.title: MNS plays 'Hanuman Chalisa' outside Shiv Sena’s Mumbai office; 2 detained
260.article_body: Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) played 'Hanuman Chalisa' on a loudspeaker outside Shiv Sena's headquarter in Mumbai on the occasion of Ram Navami on Sunday. The Mumbai Police stopped the 'Hanuman Chalisa' and detained MNS leader Yashwant Killedar and a taxi driver. This comes after MNS chief Raj Thackeray called for the removal of loudspeakers from mosques.

261.title: Distributing freebies policy decision of parties, can't intervene: EC tells SC
261.article_body: The Election Commission (EC) informed the Supreme Court that distributing freebies is a policy decision of a political party and that it doesn't have the power to intervene. "Whether such decisions are financially viable or have an adverse effect, has to be decided by voters," the EC added. Such an action would be an overreach of its powers, it claimed.

262.title: Shehbaz Sharif nominated as new Pakistan PM by country's Opposition
262.article_body: The Leader of Opposition in the National Assembly of Pakistan, Shehbaz Sharif, has been nominated as the next PM of the country after Imran Khan was dismissed as Pakistan's PM on Sunday. Sharif is the president of the Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz (PML-N) party. Khan became the first Pakistani PM to lose the no-trust vote in Parliament.

263.title: Italian Embassy counsellor robbed off her handbag in Delhi; 2 arrested
263.article_body: A 54-year-old counsellor working at the Italian Embassy was robbed of her handbag by unidentified persons at Delhi's Barapullah flyover. The victim was heading home in an auto from her office when one of the accused robbed her of her handbag containing her phone, ID cards, debit cards and gold jewellery. Police have arrested two persons in this connection.

264.title: 26-year-old man arrested for invading pitch and giving fist bumps to Kohli, Rohit
264.article_body: A 26-year-old man has been arrested by Pune Police for invading the pitch during MI-RCB match on Saturday. He was booked by police on charges of trespassing and creating ruckus as he was seen giving fist bumps to Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma before being escorted out. A police official said that the fan also manhandled the policemen on duty.

265.title: Traffic to be suspended for 30 mins for test blast at Noida twin towers today
265.article_body: Traffic movement will be suspended for 30 minutes, from 2.15-2.45 pm on Sunday, around Supertech's twin towers in Noida, where a test blast would be carried out around 2.30 pm. The area will be cordoned off by police. "Traffic movement will be restricted from ATS junction to Gejha Phool Mandi and from Eldeco Chowk to Sector 108," an inspector said.

266.title: Reports claim Imran Khan tried to remove Pakistan Army chief, he denies
266.article_body: Ex-Pakistan PM Imran Khan tried to dismiss Army chief General Qamar Javed Bajwa but a notification was not issued by the Defence Ministry, reports said. However, according to Geo News, Khan told journalists, "There was neither any talk of dismissing the Army chief nor was this on the cards." Khan lost the no-confidence vote and was removed as Pakistan's PM.

267.title: The Kashmir Files is the real game changer, not RRR: Ram Gopal Varma
267.article_body: Filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma believes the success of 'The Kashmir Files' is "the real game changer" being made on a small budget of ₹10 crore. "RRR isn't a game-changer and...I don't think it can bring about a change. It's a film that's produced on a lavish scale." "Whereas, if you consider 'The Kashmir Files'...It gives filmmakers... much-needed confidence," he said.

268.title: 2 minor boys drown in lake while swimming with friends in Thane
268.article_body: Two boys, aged 11 and 12 years, drowned while swimming in a lake in Thane, police said on Sunday. The incident took place when six boys from Dhamankar Naka entered the Varaladevi lake for a swim. While four of the boys came out of the lake after swimming, they informed police as they were unable to locate the two others.

269.title: Pune locals protest as BJP corporator renames garden after father
269.article_body: Residents of Pune's Salisbury Park have been protesting for the past three weeks after BJP corporator Shrinath Bhimale renamed a PMC garden after his father, late Yashwantrao Bhimale, and put up a board with the name on it. A resident forum's chairman said that while they acknowledged Bhimale's efforts for the garden, its renaming seemed like "an attempt to hog..limelight".

270.title: Alia respects everyone a lot, she's not jealous of anyone: Neetu
270.article_body: Neetu Kapoor said in an interview that actress Alia Bhatt is a very sweet and nice girl. She added that the 29-year-old actress respects everyone a lot and is not jealous of anyone. "Ranbir too is a kind-hearted guy. They both make a great pair," Neetu further said. The couple will reportedly get married in an intimate ceremony this week.

271.title: Anupam shares pic with Big B, Neena; fan says 'History of cinema in 1 pic'
271.article_body: Anupam Kher, taking to Instagram, shared a selfie with the cast of his upcoming film, 'Uunchai'. The picture featured Amitabh Bachchan, Boman Irani, Neena Gupta and Sarika. "May your day feel as good as taking a perfect selfie of perfect happy moments," Anupam wrote. Reacting to his post, a fan wrote, "History of cinema in this one picture is remarkable."

272.title: Cong should worry about itself: Mayawati on Rahul's UP alliance offer comment
272.article_body: A day after Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said BSP chief Mayawati didn't respond to the party's alliance offer in Uttar Pradesh during elections, Mayawati said the Congress needs to worry about itself first. "The Congress must think 100 times before making such comments. They've been unable to win against the BJP, but they just keep taking these potshots," she added.

273.title: Ukraine says 12 soldiers returning after prisoner swap with Russia
273.article_body: Ukraine's Deputy Prime Minister Iryna Vereshchuk said that 12 of the country's soldiers are coming home following a prisoner exchange with Russia on Saturday. Apart from soldiers, Vereshchuk said that 14 civilians were also returning to Ukraine as part of the deal. This was the third such prisoner swap since the war began, she added.

274.title: Mumbai's Mithi river polluted for last 11 years: MPCB report
274.article_body: A report published by the Maharashtra Pollution Control Board (MPCB) has revealed that Mumbai's Mithi river has remained 'polluted to heavily polluted' for the past 11 years. The 17.8 km long river was found once (2012-13) in the non-polluted category in the past 11 years. The water quality index (WQI) of the river was 44 in 2020-21, the report said.

275.title: Amrinder Singh Brar appointed as Congress’ Punjab chief
275.article_body: Three-time MLA Amrinder Singh Brar, also known as Raja Warring, was appointed as the Congress' new Punjab chief by party President Sonia Gandhi on Saturday. Warring served as the Transport Minister in the previous state government. Meanwhile, Pratap Singh Bajwa was appointed as the leader of legislature party, while Raj Kumar as its deputy leader.

276.title: Comedian Munawar Faruqui confirms on 'Lock Upp' he is married and has a son
276.article_body: Comedian Munawar Faruqui, during an episode of 'Lock Upp', confirmed he is married and has a son. "I'm not hiding anything, but we've been separate for the past one-and-a-half years. The matter is in court and I don't want to discuss that. It has been difficult," Munawar said. He later suggested that he is doing the show for his son.

277.title: BJP MP shares video of 92-yr-old man completing 5 km-run in B'luru
277.article_body: BJP MP Tejasvi Surya on Sunday shared a video of a 92-year-old man completing a 5 km run at Bengaluru Marathon, saying, "[Sri Dattatreya Ji] truly symbolises the spirit of grit and determination of every Bengalurean." In the video, Surya can be seen holding Dattatreya's hand while they crossed the finish line. Surya added that Dattatreya had "outpaced" many others.

278.title: Karan shares pic of Farah shopping for 'designer wear' on New York Streets
278.article_body: Karan Johar shared a picture of choreographer-director Farah Khan as she shopped on the streets of New York. Taking to Instagram Stories, Karan posted a photo of Farah standing near a roadside shop selling sunglasses. Alongside it, he wrote, "Caught you! Shopping for high-end designer wear! Show off @farahkhankunder." Sharing Karan's post, Farah wrote, "I live for your comments @karanjohar."

279.title: Dozens of Ukrainian civilians found in grave near Kyiv
279.article_body: A grave with dozens of Ukrainian civilians has been found in Buzova village near Kyiv, the latest reported mass grave to be discovered as Russian forces retreat, an official said. Ukraine said Russia is gathering its forces in the east for a major assault and urged people to flee. UK PM Boris Johnson met Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Saturday.

280.title: RCB's Harshal Patel leaves IPL bio-bubble after death of a family member
280.article_body: RCB all-rounder Harshal Patel has left the IPL bio-bubble following the death of a family member. Harshal exited the bubble after getting to know about the tragedy in the family after the match against MI on Saturday night, PTI reported. Harshal is expected to join the bubble before RCB's next match.

281.title: YouTube blocks Russian parliament's Duma TV; Russia criticises
281.article_body: YouTube has blocked Russia's lower parliament house's broadcast channel Duma TV, saying that it was "terminated" for violating the terms of service. "YouTube has signed its own warrant," Russia's Foreign Ministry spokeswoman Maria Zakharova said. Russian leader Vyacheslav Volodin also reacted to it, saying that this shows that the US is trying to achieve a "monopoly of information".

282.title: Fire breaks out at Ghazipur landfill site in Delhi for 2nd time in 2 weeks
282.article_body: Another fire broke out at the Ghazipur landfill site in Delhi on Saturday late night, nearly two weeks after a massive fire broke out at same site which took firefighters nearly 48 hours to extinguish. The Saturday's fire was put out within three hours after Delhi Fire Service (DFS) officials sent four fire tenders to the spot within 10-15 minutes.

283.title: We're planning such that foreigners will seek jobs in Punjab: Mann
283.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Saturday called for the stop of the "brain drain" from the state, saying, "We're planning in such...way that foreigners will come here for jobs." Following this, Congress MLA Sukhpal Khaira criticised the remark, saying, "Hope foreigners approach...but...we've to set our house in order." Mann claimed that ₹15 lakh was lost per person going abroad.

284.title: Hope I can move on: Amber shares statement ahead of Johnny Depp Defamation Case
284.article_body: Amber Heard said she hopes she and her ex-husband Johnny Depp can move on from their defamation trials, which are set to begin on April 11. On Saturday, she wrote, "I've always maintained a love for Johnny and it brings me great pain to have to live out the details of our past life together in front of the world."

285.title: IIT-Kanpur's annual cultural fest Antaragni is being held from Apr 8-10
285.article_body: Celebrating its 56th edition with the theme of 'A Nouvelle Rhapsody', IIT-Kanpur's annual cultural festival 'Antaragni' is being conducted in a hybrid mode for the first time ever. It offers a virtually immersive experience of the IIT-Kanpur Campus with all events, online and offline, being streamed on the platform. Key highlights include performances from artists Ritviz and Sunidhi Chauhan.

286.title: 'RRR' crosses ₹1,000-crore mark globally in 16 days
286.article_body: SS Rajamouli-directorial 'RRR' has crossed the ₹1,000-crore mark globally in 16 days of its release. The Ram Charan and Jr NTR-starrer 'RRR' is the third Indian film after 'Dangal' and 'Baahubali 2: The Conclusion' to earn ₹1,000 crore worldwide. 'Dangal' is the highest-grossing Indian film of all time with over ₹2,000-crore worldwide earnings.

287.title: Jaffer shares scene from Yuvraj's movie as child actor; jokes about MI, CSK's losses
287.article_body: Wasim Jaffer took to Twitter to share a scene from Yuvraj Singh's Punjabi movie 'Mehndi Shagna Di' to joke about MI and CSK losing their first four matches each in IPL 2022. In the scene, Yuvraj, standing with his friend, tells their teacher, "We've taken an oath that if we win, we'll win together, if we lose, we'll lose together."

288.title: David Beckham's son Brooklyn marries actress Nicola Peltz, pics from wedding surface
288.article_body: Former England football team captain David Beckham's eldest son Brooklyn tied the knot with American actress Nicola Peltz in Palm Beach. Tennis player Serena Williams, Spice Girl Mel C, fashion designer Rachel Zoe and TV chef Gordon Ramsay were among those who attended the wedding ceremony. The couple had got engaged in July 2020.

289.title: Amit Shah inaugurates Indo-Pak border viewing project at Gujarat's Nadabet
289.article_body: Home Minister Amit Shah on Sunday inaugurated the border viewing point on the India-Pakistan international border in Nadabet in Gujarat's Banaskantha district. The viewing point has been made on the lines of the one at Punjab's Wagah Border. According to officials, the project was developed as a tourist attraction destination at a cost of ₹125 crore by Gujarat's tourism department.

290.title: Hope you're blessed with everything: Samantha on Naga's brother Akhil's b'day
290.article_body: Samantha Ruth Prabhu, who parted ways with her ex-husband Naga Chaitanya in 2021, has penned a note on the occasion of Naga's actor-brother Akhil Akkineni's birthday. The actress, taking to her Instagram Stories, wrote, "Happy birthday Akhil. Wishing you the very best this year. I hope and pray you are blessed with everything you are looking for. God Bless."

291.title: We can also take action against Kejriwal in BJP-ruled states: Singh
291.article_body: After Punjab Police booked BJP leader Naveen Jindal, the party's West Delhi MP Parvesh Sahib Singh has said that BJP can also file FIRs against AAP leaders but the party doesn't believe in "low-level politics". "We've BJP governments in more than half of the states...we can take action against [Delhi CM and AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal] there," he added.

292.title: 300-yr-old Karaga festival begins at Bengaluru's Dharmaraya temple
292.article_body: The 300-year-old Karaga festival began at the Dharmaraya Swamy Temple in Bengaluru on Saturday. The festival was held exclusively within the temple in the last two years owing to the Covid-19 pandemic. However this year, the organisers will take out the 'Hasi Karaga' (procession) on April 14 while the 'Karaga Shakyotsava' (the main event) will be held on April 16.

293.title: China records 1,351 new COVID-19 cases, highest in Shanghai
293.article_body: China recorded 1,351 new COVID-19 cases on Saturday, including 1,318 locally transmitted and 33 imported infections, said the country's health authorities. Shanghai, which has been put under a strict lockdown, saw 1,006 locally confirmed cases, the highest of all cities. 242 cases were reported in Jilin, 16 in Zhejiang, 10 in Guangdong, and three in Beijing.

294.title: Nana Patekar to make comeback with social-thriller 'The Confession'
294.article_body: Actor Nana Patekar is set to make an acting comeback with a social-thriller, titled 'The Confession'. It will be directed by Ananth Narayan Mahadevan, who has helmed films like 'The Xpose', 'Aksar' and 'Dil Maange More!!!'. The 71-year-old actor had reportedly taken a break from acting after actress Tanushree Dutta accused him of sexual harassment during the #MeToo movement.

295.title: Australian PM Scott Morrison calls for elections on May 21
295.article_body: Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison has called for federal elections to be held on May 21. Morrison said that Governor-General David Hurley, who he met on Sunday at his residence, accepted his advice on setting the election date. Following the announcement, the opposition - Australian Labor party - tweeted, "It's time for better Medicare. It's time for better aged care."

296.title: Iceland Cricket mock third umpire over Virat Kohli's controversial dismissal
296.article_body: Iceland Cricket mocked the third umpire over ex-RCB captain Virat Kohli's controversial dismissal against MI. Iceland Cricket tweeted, "It's not easy for on-field umpires to detect inside edges or whether ball hit bat or pad first. But every TV umpire should be able to make the right call with the benefit of slow motion replays and technology like UltraEdge."

297.title: UGC India's Twitter account briefly hacked; 3rd govt account targeted in 2 days
297.article_body: The official Twitter account of University Grants Commission (UGC) India was briefly hacked on Sunday. The account's display and background pictures were changed to photos of cartoons and a long thread of tweets were posted, tagging numerous Twitter users. This comes after the Twitter accounts of Uttar Pradesh CM's Office and India Meteorological Department's (IMD) were hacked on Saturday.

298.title: Big B sends handwritten letter to Nimrat praising her performance in 'Dasvi'
298.article_body: Amitabh Bachchan recently sent a handwritten letter to Nimrat Kaur along with some flowers to praise her 'exceptional work' in her latest film 'Dasvi'.  "Your work in 'Dasvi' is exceptional - nuances, gestures, all! My deep admiration and congratulations," he wrote in the letter. Nimrat also penned a note thanking Amitabh for sending her flowers and letter for the film.

299.title: Musk takes poll to turn Twitter HQ in San Francisco into homeless shelter
299.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has started a poll on his Twitter account asking whether the firm's San Francisco headquarters should be converted into a homeless shelter. The poll read, "Convert Twitter SF HQ to homeless shelter since no one shows up anyway." The poll has got over 6.6 lakh votes till now, with over 91% answering yes.

300.title: Aus PM cooks PM Modi's 'favourite khichdi' to celebrate India trade deal, shares pics
300.article_body: Australia PM Scott Morrison took to Instagram to reveal that he celebrated his country's new trade agreement with India by cooking Indian dishes. "The curries I chose to cook for curry night...are all from my dear friend Prime Minister Narendra Modi's Gujarat province, including his favourite khichdi," he wrote. "Good job, looks delicious," an Instagram user commented.

301.title: Won't spare anyone: Telangana Minister to pubs after Hyd drug bust case
301.article_body: After the recent drug bust by the police inside a Hyderabad pub, the state's Tourism and Excise Minister V Srinivas Goud has said that they "won't spare anyone". "If need be, we will shut down everything...It's not about revenues, but the...reputation of Telangana," Goud said during a review meeting with the representatives of various pubs and bars of Hyderabad.

302.title: Johnny Lever, Rajpal Yadav arrive together at an event, fan says 'Comedy Kings'
302.article_body: Actors Johnny Lever and Rajpal Yadav, who have appeared together in films like 'Coolie No.1' and 'Hungama 2' met on Thursday at an event. A paparazzo account shared a video featuring Johnny and Rajpal from the event. The video received a lot of appreciation. One of the fans called them, "The Bollywood legends of laughter." Another user commented, "Comedy Kings."

303.title: CBI books 10 persons over TMC leader's murder that preceded Birbhum violence
303.article_body: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) has registered an FIR against 10 persons in connection with TMC panchayat leader Bhadu Sheikh's murder, which allegedly led to the killing of nine persons in West Bengal's Birbhum, a senior official said. The CBI visited Rampurhat police station and collected the case diary and documents linked to Sheikh's murder investigation, the official added.

304.title: Class 10 girl killed by a speeding truck on way to exam in Surat
304.article_body: A Class 10 girl, who was going to the exam centre to write her Hindi board exam, was killed by a speeding truck near Bhesan village road in Surat. The deceased, Pragati Sadashiv (16), was going on a moped with her uncle to Segva village when the truck hit them, police said. Her uncle, Chhagan Rathod, has suffered serious injuries.

305.title: India reports 1,054 new COVID-19 cases, 29 deaths in last 24 hours
305.article_body: India has reported 1,054 fresh COVID-19 cases, 1,258 recoveries and 29 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. It comes a day after the country reported 1,150 COVID-19 cases and 83 deaths. The number of active COVID-19 cases in the country stands at 11,132, while the death toll reached 5,21,685.

306.title: Gurugram records 44.5°C, second hottest April day in 43 years
306.article_body: Gurugram witnessed its second hottest day recorded in the month of April in 43 years as the maximum temperature hit 44.5°C on Saturday. According to India Meteorological Department, the last time the city saw a higher temperature was in 1979 when it recorded 44.8°C on April 28. The maximum temperature was 10°C above the average normal, added IMD.

307.title: Right-wing workers vandalise Muslim traders' carts at K'taka temple
307.article_body: Members of the right-wing group, Sri Ram Sene, on Saturday allegedly vandalised the carts of Muslim traders outside a Hanuman temple in Karnataka's Dharwad. A video of the incident was shared online, which shows smashed watermelons on the road. "I've been doing business in front of this temple for...15 years and never had a problem," a watermelon seller said.

308.title: Women police station in Noida gets new daycare centre
308.article_body: A daycare centre for children has been started at the women police station in Noida's Sector 39. This is the second such facility in Gautam Buddha Nagar after the one in Surajpur was opened last year. DCP Vrinda Shukla said that the facility was conceptualised in January and subsequently set up with the help of a private firm.

309.title: Spain's Barcelona to ban smoking on all of its 10 beaches
309.article_body: Authorities in Spain's second-largest city Barcelona have announced that they'll ban smoking on all of the city's 10 beaches from this year. This comes after a pilot project in which smoking was banned at four beaches. "Beaches with no smoking allowed will offer healthier communal living areas, with less waste and will respect the defence of the environment," authorities said.

310.title: Harbhajan Singh asks Ashish Nehra what Rahul Tewatia eats, GT respond with a pic
310.article_body:
After GT all-rounder Rahul Tewatia slammed two sixes on the last two deliveries to help his team defeat PBKS, Harbhajan Singh asked GT head coach Ashish Nehra what Tewatia eats. GT responded to Harbhajan with a screengrab from one of their videos wherein Tewatia can be seen eating fafda. "
Psst! It's a secret. Don't tell anyone," GT wrote.

311.title: What does the law say regarding Kohli's controversial dismissal against MI?
311.article_body: RCB batter Virat Kohli was declared LBW out against MI's Dewald Brevis by third umpire, who stated that he can't overturn on-field umpire's decision as ball hit the bat and pad simultaneously. As per MCC's rules, if the ball makes contact with the striker's pad and bat simultaneously, this shall be considered as the ball having first touched the bat.

312.title: Video shows Ronaldo smashing fan's phone after Manchester United's defeat
312.article_body: A video has surfaced which purportedly shows Cristiano Ronaldo smashing a fan's phone following Manchester United's 1-0 defeat to Everton at Goodison Park on Saturday. "I'd like to apologise for my outburst and, if possible, I would like to invite this supporter to watch a game at Old Trafford as a sign of fair-play and sportsmanship," Ronaldo said on Instagram.

313.title: discovery+ docuseries to uncover lesser-known mysteries around Ramayana
313.article_body: Ahead of Ram Navami, discovery+ has announced its docuseries 'Legends Of The Ramayana' narrated by author Amish Tripathi. Subscribers can watch the series, shot across India and Sri Lanka, to uncover questions like 'what is the name of Shri Rama's sister?,' 'what's the mystery behind Rama Setu stones?,' 'why did Shri Rama's vanvaas last 14 years?' and more such mysteries.

314.title: 5 hurt, several trapped as part of building collapses in Punjab; casualties suspected
314.article_body: At least five persons sustained injuries and several others were left trapped under debris after a portion of an under-construction building of a private university located on Airport Road in Punjab's Mohali collapsed on Saturday late night. Rescue workers were rushed to the spot immediately after the incident. "We suspect that there are casualties," a police officer said.

315.title: I'll be there whenever he wants me: Neetu on working with son Ranbir
315.article_body: When asked if she plans to work with her son, actor Ranbir Kapoor someday, actress Neetu Kapoor said that she would love to do it anytime. "Whenever he wants me, I will be there," she said. Neetu further added that she recently shot an advertisement with Ranbir and she just loved the experience of working with him.

316.title: Shweta Bachchan shares mom Jaya's pic from her NCC days on her b'day
316.article_body: Shweta Bachchan took to Instagram on Saturday to wish her mother, Jaya Bachchan, on her 74th birthday. She shared some old pictures of Jaya and wrote, "Mother, may you always smile like you've made best NCC cadet or like you have a huge plate of crabs to devour." Actor Abhishek Bachchan also wished Jaya on her birthday.

317.title: Section 144 imposed in Rajasthan's Jaipur till May 9 after Karauli violence
317.article_body: The Jaipur administration on Saturday imposed Section 144 of CrPC till May 9, in view of the violence that broke out in Rajasthan's Karauli last week, injuring several people. The order has suspended the gathering of crowds, protests, assemblies and processions without prior permission in the area. Wedding celebrations and mournings will be exempted, according to the order.

318.title: Pune records 40 new COVID-19 cases, 4 deaths
318.article_body: Pune district saw 40 new COVID-19 cases and four deaths, the health department said on Saturday. The total number of cases recorded so far stood at around 14.5 lakh, while the death toll from the infection reached 20,538. There are currently 235 active cases. Over 1.78 crore COVID-19 vaccine doses have been administered in the district.

319.title: Big B shaped the way I thought about cinema: KGF 2 director on Sholay
319.article_body: 'KGF 2' director Prashanth Neel spoke about how Ramesh Sippy's 'Sholay' and Amitabh Bachchan changed the way he saw cinema. He said, "Amitabh Bachchan shaped the way I thought about cinema. One thing...Sholay did was, to tell...Indian audience...you can make...Hollywood movies in India with Indian emotions." "I didn't think I'd make KGF this early in my career," he added.

320.title: 466 live corals seized from Dubai passengers at Pune airport
320.article_body: As many as 466 live corals were seized from two passengers arriving from Dubai on April 5 by customs officials at Pune airport. According to an official, at least 100 corals were kept in a glass jar while 366 were in a plastic bag. The corals, protected under Wildlife Protection Act, have been sent for rehabilitation at Mumbai's Taraporevala Aquarium.

321.title: Car crashes into truck in Pune; all 4 occupants of the car killed
321.article_body: All four occupants of a car were killed after the vehicle crashed into a stationary truck from behind at high speed on the Pune-Mumbai Expressway in Pune's Gahunje on Saturday, an official said. "The driver of the truck said that his vehicle had a breakdown after which it had halted," the official added. The incident took place around 3.45 pm.

322.title: Imran Khan left Pakistan PM's official home an hour before losing no-trust vote
322.article_body: Imran Khan vacated the Pakistan Prime Minister's official residence almost an hour before he lost a no-confidence vote in the National Assembly, a senior leader from his party, Faisal Javed Khan, said on Sunday. After Speaker Asad Qaiser handed over the reins to Opposition's Ayaz Sadiq, it seemed the voting on no-trust motion would go ahead and Khan would lose.

323.title: Duo wanted in 25 cases arrested for cheating senior citizens in Navi Mumbai
323.article_body: Two men were arrested for cheating senior citizens by claiming a murder was reported in their area and urging them to hand over their valuables for their own safety. The accused were wanted in 25 cases in Navi Mumbai. They allegedly wrapped the valuables in a handkerchief for the victims and handed over another bundle that had stones or papers.

324.title: Virat Kohli gets angry after controversial dismissal, reaction goes viral
324.article_body: A video of RCB batter Virat Kohli's reaction to his controversial dismissal against MI went viral. In the video, Kohli can be seen smashing bat on the ground in anger and muttering continuously on his way back to the pavilion. Kohli was dismissed LBW after third umpire didn't overturn the original decision, saying ball touched the bat and pad simultaneously.

325.title: Fans question whether Virat Kohli's LBW dismissal against MI was out or not
325.article_body: RCB's Virat Kohli was adjudged LBW out by the on-field umpire during his team's match against MI on Saturday. Kohli took a review, with the third umpire sticking with the decision made by the on-field umpire, saying that the ball hit the bat and pad simultaneously. "Kohli is always a victim of controversial LBW calls (atrocious umpiring)," a fan tweeted.

326.title: Traffic on Delhi-Gurugram highway disrupted for hours after crane catches fire
326.article_body: Traffic on the Delhi-Gurugram expressway (NH-48) came to a halt on Saturday after a 50-tonne 18-wheeler hydraulic crane allegedly caught fire near Delhi's Mahipalpur. "We tried removing it with five-seven cranes, but...it couldn't be removed. We've now brought in a larger crane," a police officer said. Commuters going from Gurugram to Delhi reportedly remained stranded for hours on the highway.

327.title: Baby AB takes Virat Kohli's wicket on his first-ever delivery in IPL
327.article_body: MI's 18-year-old batter Dewald Brevis, who is nicknamed Baby AB, dismissed RCB's Virat Kohli on his first-ever delivery in IPL. Kohli was adjudged LBW out for 48(36) on Brevis' delivery. The South African bowled three deliveries in the match, conceding eight runs and taking a wicket. RCB defeated MI by seven wickets.

328.title: B'luru man who raped 13-yr-old daughter while wife was away jailed
328.article_body: A 51-year-old man from Bengaluru, who is accused of repeatedly raping his 13-year-old daughter while his wife was reportedly at her parental home, has been sentenced to 20 years of rigorous imprisonment. The incident occurred in 2015. It is believed that the wife hadn't wanted to report the matter to the police, however, a neighbour informed a child welfare committee.

329.title: Senior police officer removed over protest outside Pawar's Mumbai home
329.article_body: Mumbai Police Joint Commissioner (Law & Order) Vishwas Nangre Patil on Saturday removed DCP (Zone II), Yogesh Kumar, from his post in connection with the protest by MSRTC employees outside the house of NCP chief Sharad Pawar in Mumbai. Neelotpal, DCP (Detection) of Mumbai Police Crime Branch, has been given the post. Kumar was removed for failing to discharge duties.

330.title: Imran Khan removed as Pakistan Prime Minister after losing no-trust vote
330.article_body: Imran Khan has been removed as Pakistan Prime Minister after he lost the no-trust vote against him in Pakistan's National Assembly. The results of the vote were declared at around 1.30 am IST, with 174 members favouring the resolution of no-trust. With this, Imran became the first Prime Minister in Pakistan's history to be ousted through a no-confidence motion.

331.title: RCB hand MI their 4th straight defeat in IPL 2022, jump to 3rd on the points table
331.article_body: RCB defeated MI by seven wickets to register their third straight victory in IPL 2022. RCB have jumped to the third spot on the points table, while MI joined CSK in losing their first four matches of IPL 2022. Opener Anuj Rawat top-scored for RCB with 66*(47) as RCB chased down the 152-run target in 18.3 overs.

332.title: Global pledging event raises $11 bn to support Ukrainians amid war
332.article_body: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen on Saturday said that a global pledging event raised 10.1 billion euros (nearly $11 billion) to support Ukrainian refugees and internally displaced people in Ukraine. The 'Stand Up For Ukraine' event was convened by the EU and Canadian PM Justin Trudeau. More than 44 lakh people have fled the conflict in Ukraine.

333.title: We'll devise our best plan vs KKR: DC fast bowling coach Hopes
333.article_body: DC fast bowling coach James Hopes said his side will "devise" the best plan against KKR and will look to win the key moments on Sunday. "KKR are a good team...they have two world-class spinners surrounded by a very solid pace attack and some batters who are match-winners," he added. "We haven't played our best cricket yet," Hopes further said.

334.title: AR Rahman's tweet on 'Goddess Tamil' goes viral after Amit Shah's Hindi remark
334.article_body: An illustration of 'Thamizhanangu' (Goddess Tamil) shared by AR Rahman has gone viral on Twitter. Rahman also included a line written by modern Tamil poet Bharathidasan which read, "Beloved Tamil is the root of our existence." This comes after Union Home Minister Amit Shah's statement that people of different states should communicate with each other in Hindi and not English.

335.title: Ross Taylor replies in Hindi to Sachin Tendulkar's tweet on his retirement
335.article_body: Former New Zealand batter Ross Taylor took to Twitter to reply in Hindi to Sachin Tendulkar's congratulatory tweet following his retirement. "Shukria Sachin Bhai, aap ki recognition ke liye," Taylor wrote. He further wrote in English, "To get this message from my favourite player growing up is an absolute honour."

336.title: Relegation-threatened Everton beat Man Utd 1-0 in Premier League
336.article_body: Everton on Saturday beat Manchester United 1-0 in the Premier League to boost their chances of avoiding relegation. Everton are currently 17th in the table, now four points above the relegation zone. Everton's Anthony Gordon scored the winner in the 27th minute. Manchester United are in seventh place after the defeat, three points off fourth place.

337.title: My Infosys stake is testament to my father Narayana Murthy's work: Akshata
337.article_body: UK Finance Minister Rishi Sunak's wife Akshata Murty said, "My long-standing shareholding in Infosys is not just a financial investment but also testament to my father's (NR Narayana Murthy) work." The couple recently faced criticism over Akshata's 0.9% stake in Infosys and her non-domicile status. Akshata has said that she will start paying UK taxes on all her overseas income.

338.title: Janhvi Kapoor mobbed ahead of store inauguration in Lucknow: Report
338.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor was mobbed by fans and guests ahead of inaugurating a store at a mall in Lucknow, reported ETimes. As per the report, the actress was an hour and a half late for the event and the guests outnumbered the bouncers. The store spokesperson stated that Janhvi's arrival was delayed so she only did a photoshoot and left.

339.title: Jordan's King to undergo urgent surgery for slipped disc in Germany
339.article_body: Jordan's King Abdullah II will undergo urgent surgery for a slipped disc in the back at a hospital in Germany, an official statement announced. "His Majesty had previously been experiencing intermittent pain in the spinal cord after years of parachuting while serving in...Special Forces," it said. "The surgery will be followed by rest for around a week," it added.

340.title: 'RRR' has given 21st century a new pair of Jai-Veeru: Javed Akhtar
340.article_body: Lyricist Javed Akhtar spoke at the 'RRR' success party saying that besides making a memorable film and a game-changer, director SS Rajamouli has given the 21st century another pair of Jai and Veeru. "There are a few films, stars, and directors who are remembered forever," he added. Rajamouli greeted Javed with a hug and touched his feet.

341.title: No one is telling us why he was shot dead: Father of 21-year-old Indian killed in Canada
341.article_body: Jitesh Vasudev, the father of 21-year-old Kartik who was shot dead in Canada, said, "No one is telling us why a young boy was shot dead." He said, "I've received no phone call from Embassy or Canadian authorities." He added, "His bag was left behind and it seems it was not a robbery. It's possible it was a hate crime."

342.title: MI and DC have weakened bowling departments in IPL 2022: Shastri
342.article_body: Ravi Shastri has said MI and DC are the two teams that have a "weakened" bowling department in IPL 2022. He explained that MI without Hardik and Krunal Pandya and Trent Boult are "feeling the heat" as they're lacking that firepower to push. He added that DC are also feeling the same as don't have Kagiso Rabada and Anrich Nortje.

343.title: Owner arrested after pics show horse travelling by train in Bengal
343.article_body: A 40-year-old man, Gafoor Ali Mollah, was arrested by RPF on Friday after pictures showed a horse travelling by train in West Bengal. Mollah's horse travelled 23 km via train after participating in a race. "He has been booked under various sections of Railway Act for creating nuisance in railway property and unauthorised occupation in a train," an official said.

344.title: We're like brothers: Ajay Devgn on being friends with contemporaries
344.article_body: Actor Ajay Devgn, speaking about rivalry with his contemporaries, has said that they are all like brothers and are there for each other. He added that he had called Salman Khan a few years ago about releasing a film on Eid. "So many times, Akshay (Kumar) tweets for me, I do for him and others," the actor stated.

345.title: 2 militant associates of Lashkar-e-Taiba arrested in J&K
345.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Police on Saturday arrested two militant associates of terror outfit Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) from Beerwah in Budgam district, police said. Incriminating material of LeT, arms and ammunition, including a Chinese pistol and 12 pistol rounds, have been seized from their possession, police added. A case has been registered and an investigation has been launched into the matter.

346.title: We need to work hard on our game: Jadeja on CSK's 4th straight loss
346.article_body: Following CSK's fourth consecutive defeat in IPL 2022, captain Ravindra Jadeja said the team needs to sit down and talk. "I think tomorrow might be a day off. We'll look to improve in both departments...we are all professional cricketers, we need to work hard on our game," he added. Jadeja is yet to lead CSK to a win as captain.

347.title: Jharkhand to hold three-tier panchayat polls from May 14 to 27
347.article_body: The three-tier panchayat polls in Jharkhand will be held from May 14 to May 27 in four phases, the State Election Commission (SEC) announced. Notably, 9,470 seats will be added to the open category as the polls will be held without any reservations for OBCs. The reservations for the seats have been removed in compliance with a Supreme Court order.

348.title: Delhi sees hottest day in 72 yrs in April 1st half with max temperature at 42.4°C
348.article_body: The maximum temperature in Delhi reached 42.4°C on Saturday, making it the hottest day of April's first half in 72 years. Today's temperature broke the previous record for April 1-15 of 41.6°C, recorded on April 8 this year, and April 12 and 13 in 2010. IMD has said that Delhi recorded April's hottest day in five years on Saturday.

349.title: Efforts to unite Opp'n parties have not materialised yet: RJD
349.article_body: RJD leader Manoj Kumar Jha on Saturday said that the efforts to unite the Opposition have not materialised yet. "Opposition parties have to clear their vision for unemployment, inflation, and a better economy, only then opposition unity is possible," he added. Earlier, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi had said discussions were on to unite Opposition parties against the PM and RSS.

350.title: Which are the 10 highest-grossing Indian films worldwide?
350.article_body: According to trade analyst Manobala Vijayabalan, 'Dangal' is the highest-grossing Indian film of all time with over ₹2,000-crore worldwide collection. It's followed by 'Baahubali 2: The Conclusion' with over ₹1,810 crore and the recently-released 'RRR', which is nearing the ₹1,000-crore mark. 'RRR' is followed by 'Bajrangi Bhaijaan', 'Secret Superstar', 'PK', '2.0' and 'Baahubali: The Beginning'.

351.title: All-round game: Jaffer on SRH opener Abhishek's 50-ball 75 vs CSK
