351.article_body: Praising Abhishek Sharma for his 50-ball 75 in SRH's eight-wicket win against CSK in IPL 2022, Wasim Jaffer said it was an all-round game by the SRH opener. "Well played Abhishek! Sweet striker of the ball but packs a punch too. You saw the pull...lofted cover drive...big slog sweep and the flat batted shot over long on," he tweeted.

352.title: Rahul Tewatia should be nicknamed 'Iceman': Sunil Gavaskar
352.article_body: Referring to Rahul Tewatia slamming two sixes on the last two deliveries to help GT defeat PBKS, Sunil Gavaskar said, "What is running through his veins? It's not blood. Ice!" He added, "Tewatia should be nicknamed 'Iceman'." He added, "If there was anybody who was going to take Gujarat home, it was going to be Tewatia."

353.title: Who was Kartik Vasudev, the 21-year-old Indian shot dead in Canada?
353.article_body: Kartik Vasudev, a 21-year-old student from Ghaziabad was shot multiple times outside a subway station in Toronto. Vasudev arrived in Canada in January to study global business marketing and management at Seneca University. He had completed his undergraduate education from IP University in Delhi. Kartik's family said he was a quiet boy who never got into any fights at school.

354.title: The notion of success is very different now: Suchitra Krishnamoorthi
354.article_body: Actress Suchitra Krishnamoorthi, who starred in 1994 film 'Kabhi Haan Kabhi Naa', has said that the notion, concept and consumption of success are very different now. "Now it's not only about films, there are other mediums like TV or OTT to explore one's creativity. I see youngsters on Instagram, YouTube and other mediums doing so well," the actress added.

355.title: I thanked MSD, he said 'I had nothing to do with the decision': Uthappa on CSK buying him
355.article_body: Robin Uthappa revealed that two days after IPL mega auction, MS Dhoni called him to welcome him to CSK. "I said, 'Thank you for having faith in me'. He said, 'I had nothing to do with this decision'," Uthappa added. "Dhoni said, 'If I've anything to do with the decision...people will...think I picked you because you're my friend'," Uthappa stated.

356.title: Anyone will be happy to get him: SRH debutant Jansen on dismissing Dhoni
356.article_body: Pacer Marco Jansen, who took MS Dhoni's wicket on his SRH debut in IPL 2022, said anyone will be happy to dismiss the CSK wicketkeeper-batter. "Nervous at the start, but nice to get the opportunity...there wasn't much swing for me, so I went for...cross-seam route," he added. The 21-year-old pacer posted bowling figures of 4-0-30-1. Dhoni was dismissed at three.

357.title: 4.1-magnitude earthquake hits Uttarakhand's Uttarkashi
357.article_body: An earthquake of magnitude 4.1 on the Richter scale hit Uttarakhand's Uttarkashi on Saturday, the National Centre for Seismology (NCS) informed on Twitter. According to the NCS, the earthquake took place at 4:52 pm at a depth of 10 kilometres and around 30 kilometres North-West of Uttarkashi. However, no reports of damage or loss of lives have been reported yet.

358.title: It was some exhibition of quality shots: Irfan on Abhishek's 75 vs CSK
358.article_body: Reacting to Abhishek Sharma's 50-ball 75 against CSK in IPL 2022, ex-India all-rounder Irfan Pathan tweeted, "That was some exhibition of quality shots." The SunRisers Hyderabad opener hit five fours and three sixes during his innings. He was adjudged 'Player of the Match' in SRH's eight-wicket win against CSK at DY Patil Stadium. Notably, It is Abhishek's maiden IPL half-century.

359.title: Most of the 'top' accounts rarely tweet, is Twitter dying?: Elon Musk
359.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk responded to a tweet listing the top 10 most followed Twitter accounts and said, "Most of these 'top' accounts tweet rarely and post very little content." "Is Twitter dying?" Musk, who is now Twitter's largest shareholder, asked. The list was topped by Barack Obama with 131.4 million followers, followed by Justin Bieber and Katy Perry.

360.title: Ghana's viral 'Coffin Dance' meme sells as NFT for $1.04 million
360.article_body: The viral 'Coffin Dance' meme has been auctioned as an NFT (non-fungible token) for 327 Ethereum worth $1.04 million. The video, which shows Ghanian pallbearers dancing while carrying a coffin, went viral during COVID-19. The pallbearers will donate 50% of the proceeds from auction to a Ukrainian charity and their friends in Ukraine, who lost their income after Russian invasion.

361.title: Wrote a letter to Satyajit Ray as a teen but never sent it: Vidya
361.article_body: Actress Vidya Balan has revealed that she wrote a letter to Oscar-winning late filmmaker Satyajit Ray as a teenager but she never sent it. "If I write a letter to Mr Ray today, it would read 'I wish you had lived longer'," the actress added. She further said that she would have loved to work with the filmmaker even today.

362.title: Iran will continue to develop its nuclear industry, says Prez
362.article_body: Iran will continue to develop its nuclear industry for peaceful purposes, according to Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi. "Our knowledge and technology in the nuclear field is not reversible," he said on Saturday. Raisi's comments came as talks between Iran and world powers in Austria's Vienna to revive the 2015 nuclear deal have stalled.

363.title: 'RRR' nears ₹1,000-crore mark, becomes 3rd highest-grossing Indian film: Report
363.article_body: 'RRR' film's worldwide box office earnings hit ₹981.67 crore and it's nearing the ₹1000-crore mark, trade analyst Manobala Vijayabalan tweeted on Saturday. 'RRR' beat 'Secret Superstar' and 'Bajrangi Bhaijaan' to become the third highest-grossing Indian film of all time, he added. 'RRR' is now reportedly the third-highest grossing Indian film after 'Dangal' and 'Baahubali 2: The Conclusion'.

364.title: Video shows drunk man beating police officer in Indore; arrested
364.article_body: A video has surfaced on social media which shows 25-year-old Dinesh Prajapati hitting a police constable, Jai Prakash Jaiswal, after snatching the latter's baton in Indore. The incident happened on Friday afternoon when the motorbikes of both hit one another. Police said Prajapati has been arrested, adding that he was drunk. Jaiswal suffered serious injuries to the head.

365.title: Sri Lanka appoint Chris Silverwood as head coach for 2 years
365.article_body: Ex-England head coach Chris Silverwood has been appointed as head coach of Sri Lanka for a two-year period, the country's cricket board announced on Saturday. Upcoming Sri Lanka-Bangladesh two-match Test series will be Silverwood's first assignment. "I'm very excited to be on board with Sri Lanka...I cannot wait to get over to Colombo and get started," said Silverwood.

366.title: India Meteorological Dept's Twitter account hacked, link to NFT drop shared
366.article_body: The official Twitter handle of India Meteorological Department (IMD) was hacked on Saturday. Hackers removed the profile picture and name from the account. They shared a link to an NFT (non-fungible token) airdrop of the "Beanz Official Collection". Earlier today, the account of Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister's Office was briefly hacked and its profile picture was changed to 'Bored Ape'.

367.title: Better.com, which fired 900 staff over a Zoom call, plans to cut its staff further
367.article_body: Mortgage lending startup Better.com, which fired 900 employees over a Zoom call last year and began firing 3,000 India and US employees last month, plans to cut its workforce further. It's offering some employees as much as 60 days of severance pay and health insurance if they agree to quit. A Better.com spokesperson confirmed the voluntary separation offers to Bloomberg.

368.title: Manchester City-Liverpool PL game biggest of the season: Foden
368.article_body: Ahead of Manchester City-Liverpool Premier League match, Manchester City midfielder Phil Foden said it's the "biggest game" that every footballer wants to play in. "Two teams fighting for the Premier League, very close on points," he added. Table-toppers Manchester City are on 73 points, with just one point lead over second-placed Liverpool. The match will be played on Sunday.

369.title: Decade-old Hindu temple vandalised in Jammu, case registered
369.article_body: A decade-old temple on the outskirts of Jammu was allegedly vandalised by unidentified miscreants on the intervening night of Friday and Saturday, prompting police to file a case. The temple priest noticed the damage caused to the idols in the morning. Police urged people to maintain communal harmony and foil designs of those trying to disturb the peace.

370.title: UK PM Boris Johnson meets Ukraine President Zelenskyy in Kyiv, pic surfaces
370.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson met Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy during a visit to Kyiv on Saturday. The embassy of Ukraine in London shared a photo of the two leaders meeting face to face, with the caption, "Surprise." "Boris Johnson's visit in Kyiv began just now with a tete-a-tete meeting with President Zelenskyy," an aide of Ukraine President said on Facebook.

371.title: All institutions in hands of RSS, we have to protect them: Rahul
371.article_body: During a book launch event in Delhi, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Saturday alleged that all institutions in India are in the hands of the RSS. He said, "We've to protect the Constitution...To save the Constitution, we've to protect our institutions...But all the institutions are in...hands of RSS." Earlier, Rahul had said that Opposition parties must unite to fight BJP.

372.title: Video shows speeding BMW hitting woman on 2-wheeler after jumping divider in Mangaluru
372.article_body: A CCTV footage has emerged which shows a speeding BMW car jumping over a divider and hitting a woman on a two-wheeler and crashing into another car in Karnataka's Mangaluru on Saturday. The video shows another woman, who was standing on the divider, narrowly escaping from being hit by the speeding car. The woman on the two-wheeler suffered critical injuries.

373.title: Ferrari's Charles Leclerc claims pole position in Aus GP qualifying
373.article_body: Ferrari's Charles Leclerc on Saturday took pole position ahead of Red Bull's Max Verstappen during the qualifying session of the Australian Grand Prix. Verstappen's teammate Sergio Perez finished third ahead of McLaren's Lando Norris in fourth. Mercedes' Lewis Hamilton came fifth with teammate George Russell finishing sixth. "We are again very close with Red Bull," said Leclerc.

374.title: Warnock retires from football aged 73 after 42-year managerial career
374.article_body: Former Queens Park Rangers, Crystal Palace and Sheffield United manager Neil Warnock on Saturday, announced his retirement from football, at the age of 73, after a 42-year managerial career. Warnock has managed more matches in English professional football than anyone else with over 1,600 games. He began his managerial career in 1980. "I've had a good run really," he said.

375.title: Over 44 lakh people fled Ukraine since start of war, says UN
375.article_body: More than 44 lakh people have fled Ukraine since the start of the war in February, according to the UN refugee agency. Of these, around 2.1 lakh are non-Ukrainians. Around 90% of those who have fled Ukraine are women and children, as the Ukrainian authorities do not allow men of military age to leave, according to AFP.

376.title: Mumbai Police records Sanjay Raut's statement in phone tapping case
376.article_body: The Mumbai Police on Saturday recorded the statement on senior Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut at the office of the party's mouthpiece Saamna. Raut is one of the two politicians whose phones were allegedly tapped illegally by the Maharashtra Intelligence Department when IPS officer Rashmi Shukla was its chief. The recording lasted for nearly one hour, a police officer said.

377.title: Didn't really feel good in the car: Max Verstappen ahead of Aus GP
377.article_body: Red Bull's Max Verstappen said he "didn't really feel good in the car" as he finished second behind Ferrari's Charles Leclerc during the qualifying session of the Australian Grand Prix on Saturday. "I think there's not been one lap where I actually felt confident, a bit of a struggle," Verstappen said ahead of the Grand Prix on Sunday.

378.title: Boris Becker found guilty of four charges in bankruptcy trial in London
378.article_body: Six-time Grand Slam champion Boris Becker was found guilty of four charges in his bankruptcy trial in London after being accused of hiding millions of pounds worth of assets including two Wimbledon trophies to avoid paying debts. Becker, 54, was acquitted of further 20 counts. He was made bankrupt on June 21, 2017. Becker had previously denied the charges.

379.title: Employees shouldn't feel pressured to answer emails late at night: Nadella
379.article_body: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella has said that managers need to set clear norms and expectations for workers so they're not pressured to answer emails late at night. "We know what stress does to workers. We need to learn the soft skills," he added. When asked if he refrains from sending emails on the weekend, Nadella said, "I'm learning every day."

380.title: IT firm Kissflow gifts BMWs to 5 senior employees to honour their loyalty
380.article_body: Chennai-based IT firm Kissflow has gifted BMW cars worth over ₹1 crore each to five of its senior employees to honour their loyalty and commitment to the company. Kissflow CEO Suresh Sambandam said these employees have been with him right from the company's inception. Some of them hail from humble background and underwent various challenges before joining Kissflow, Sambandam added.

381.title: Hats off to determination: Jay on India's win vs Netherlands in Pro League
381.article_body: BCCI Secretary Jay Shah took to Twitter to congratulate India after they defeated reigning world and Olympic champions Netherlands 2-1 in the first match of their double leg tie at FIH Women's Pro Hockey League on Friday. "Hats off to the determination of team India to come out on top," he wrote. Navneet Kaur was adjudged 'Player of the Match'.

382.title: Tourists visiting J&K due to CRPF's hard work, says Home Secy
382.article_body: Union Home Secretary Ajay Kumar Bhalla on Saturday said it's due to the hard work of CRPF that many tourists are visiting J&K and that there's a sense of security in the Union Territory. Bhalla also praised security forces for neutralising "many hardcore terrorists" in J&K over the past year. A huge quantity of arms were also seized, he added.

383.title: SRH register biggest win by wickets in IPL 2022, CSK lose 4th match in a row
383.article_body: SRH registered their first win in IPL 2022 by defeating CSK by eight wickets on Saturday. It is the biggest win by wickets in the tournament so far. CSK have now lost four matches in a row. SRH opener Abhishek Sharma top-scored in the match with 75(50) as SRH chased down the 155-run target in 17.4 overs.

384.title: RCB to bowl first against winless MI in their IPL 2022 clash, Glenn Maxwell returns
384.article_body: RCB captain Faf du Plessis won the toss and elected to bowl first against winless MI in their IPL 2022 clash. RCB have made one change to their playing XI, with Glenn Maxwell replacing Sherfane Rutherford. MI have made two changes to their playing XI, with Jaydev Unadkat replacing Tymal Mills and Ramandeep Singh replacing Daniel Sams.

385.title: What is a US green card that Rishi Sunak admitted he held as UK Finance Minister?
385.article_body: UK's Finance Minister Rishi Sunak admitted that he held a US green card for over 18 months after becoming a UK government minister. Officially known as the Permanent Resident Card, a green card grants foreign nationals the right to live and work permanently in the United States. A green card holder is considered a resident of US for tax purposes.

386.title: 132 tortured bodies found in town freed from Russian forces: Ukraine
386.article_body: Ukraine's Defence Ministry has accused Russian forces of leaving behind "tormented bodies" in the town of Makariv in the Kyiv region. It said that as Ukrainian rescuers are advancing in areas liberated by Russian forces, new "war crimes are [being] uncovered". "The town of Makariv is half-ruined. 132 tormented bodies of tortured, murdered citizens have already been found," it said.

387.title: MSRTC worker found dead near bus depot in Mumbai
387.article_body: A 43-year-old bus conductor of Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation (MSRTC), identified as Mahesh Lal, was found dead near the Parel Bus Depot in Mumbai. He had come to Mumbai from Kolhapur a few days ago to participate in the agitation outside NCP chief Sharad Pawar's house. Police don't suspect foul play but have registered a case of accidental death.

388.title: Mock drills conducted in Delhi to counter terrorist attacks
388.article_body: The Delhi Police informed on Saturday that security agencies conducted mock drills in the national capital to counter terrorist attacks. Police said that the mega counter-terror mock drill was named 'Exercise All Out' and was executed at multiple locations. The police stated that there will be simulated terror attacks at various markets, institutions and offices across Delhi.

389.title: Sri Lanka's Opp'n threats no-trust vote against govt amid crisis
389.article_body: Sri Lanka's main opposition party on Friday said that it would move a no-confidence motion against the government if it does not take measures to address the severe economic crisis in the country. "We have called a meeting with all opposition leaders and will take a final decision on it soon," Sajith Premadasa, chief of Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB), said.

390.title: Had I not conceded runs, wouldn't have got chance to hit sixes: GT's Tewatia
390.article_body: Following GT's six-wicket win against PBKS in IPL 2022, GT all-rounder Rahul Tewatia said he wouldn't have got the chance to hit sixes in final two balls against PBKS if he hadn't conceded 24 runs in his single over. Tewatia scored a 3-ball 13*. GT are the only team who haven't lost a match in IPL 2022 so far.

391.title: Don't know which one of our cousins refused to give shoes to Babar Azam: Umar Akmal
391.article_body: Reacting to Pakistan captain Babar Azam claiming a cousin once refused to lend him shoes during his formative years in cricket, Umar Akmal, one of Babar's cousins, said, "I've no idea which cousin refused to give shoes to Babar." He added, "We've always offered support to relatives who wanted to play cricket. I've never turned down a request."

392.title: Leone shares her wedding pic, says 'opened wedding envelopes to pay for reception'
392.article_body: Actress Sunny Leone took to Instagram to share a picture from her wedding to celebrate her 11th marriage anniversary with Daniel Weber. In the caption, the actress wrote, "11 years married today! A time when we had no money, less than 50 guests...opening wedding envelopes to pay for our reception." "A reminder of how far we've come together," she added.

393.title: Pune woman kills 4-month-old kitten, says, 'it used to make noise'
393.article_body: Pune Police have booked a woman for allegedly killing a four-month-old kitten. According to the police, she hit the kitten's head with a blunt object after it entered her house. The woman reportedly told the police that the kitten used to come to her house often and made "noise". Police registered the case after the woman's neighbour filed the complaint.

394.title: Cong burns effigies of Amitabh, Akshay Kumar for not protesting fuel price hikes
394.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Congress burnt the effigies of Amitabh Bachchan and Akshay Kumar for allegedly being selective in their criticism of fuel price hikes and inflation. "In 2012, these actors used to tweet against fuel price hikes and inflation...At that time, an LPG cylinder used to cost ₹300-400, while petrol and diesel was around ₹60/litre," said Congress MLA PC Sharma.

395.title: Ricky Gervais, 50 Cent support Will Smith after 10 year Oscar ban
395.article_body: After Will Smith was banned from attending Academy events for the next 10 years, Ricky Gervais and 50 Cent among others have tweeted in support of him. "Hopefully, he'll only do 6 years with good behaviour," Ricky tweeted. 50 Cent wrote, "This is too harsh...He can't come back till he 63 years old. And the lawsuit ain't even hit yet."

396.title: TMC leader says, 'We can blow up area in 10 mins'; Malviya shares video
396.article_body: BJP leader Amit Malviya on Saturday shared a video wherein a TMC leader purportedly said, "Don't worry we have so much stock of bombs and guns that we can blow up the whole area in 10 minutes." He claimed the comments were made by TMC's Deputy Pradhan Sakir Ahmad. "West Bengal under Mamata Banerjee is waiting to explode," Malviya wrote.

397.title: AAP lost deposits in UP, it'll lose in Himachal also: Anurag Thakur
397.article_body: Union Minister and BJP leader Anurag Thakur on Saturday said that the BJP will retain power in Himachal Pradesh by winning the upcoming state Assembly elections. Further speaking about Aam Aadmi Party, Thakur said, "AAP has lost deposits in Uttar Pradesh and it will lose in Himachal Pradesh also." Notably, AAP Himachal Pradesh president Anup Kesari joined BJP on Friday.

398.title: Preparing for motherhood can be beautiful but messy: Kajal Aggarwal
398.article_body: Actress Kajal Aggarwal on Saturday took to Instagram to share a picture from her maternity photoshoot, writing, "Preparing for motherhood can be beautiful but messy." The actress further wrote, "One moment you feel like you have everything under control, while the next moment, you're so drained." Kajal and her husband Gautam Kitchlu are expecting their first child together.

399.title: MI doesn't have a bowler who can support Bumrah well in IPL: Irfan
399.article_body: Irfan Pathan said MI know how to make a comeback after having lost three straight matches in IPL 2022. "In IPL 2015, they were in a similar situation...that team was a little different. This year, MI doesn't have a bowler who can support Jasprit Bumrah well. This is a major headache for...captain," he added. MI will face RCB today.

400.title: Don't expect Russia to be removed from UN Security Council: US
400.article_body: The White House on Friday said that it does not anticipate Russia to be suspended from the United Nations Security Council (UNSC). Notably, Russia is among the five permanent members of the UNSC and has veto power. Earlier, Russia was suspended from the United Nations Human Rights Council (UNHRC) in response to the Russian invasion of Ukraine.

401.title: A scene was cut off in a film, made my character look strange: Jacqueline
401.article_body: Actress Jacqueline Fernandez revealed that a filmmaker once cut her scene which made her character look very strange. Without naming the film, Jacqueline said her character had a quirk but the scene explaining it was chopped off. "A director friend came later and asked me about it and I said I have an explanation but it's too late," she added.

402.title: Imran not in his senses anymore, must be treated as psychopath: Nawaz Sharif's daughter
402.article_body: Ex-Pakistan PM Nawaz Sharif's daughter Maryam Nawaz has tweeted, "One person who is not in his senses anymore cannot be allowed to wreak havoc & bring the entire country down." She added, "He shouldn't be treated as PM or ex-PM, he must be treated as a psychopath who just to save his own skin is holding the entire country hostage."

403.title: I have a great bonding with SRK, he's a great listener: Sonu Sood
403.article_body: Actor Sonu Sood in an interview has said that he has a great bonding with actor Shah Rukh Khan, adding that the latter is a great listener. Sonu added that the two spent a lot of time together while shooting 2014 film 'Happy New Year'. "He really takes care of you as an elder brother, as a producer," Sonu said.

404.title: Russia expels 45 Polish diplomats in a tit-for-tat move
404.article_body: Russia has expelled 45 Polish embassy and consulate staff and declared them "persona non grata", the Russian Foreign Ministry said. This comes after Poland expelled the same number of Russian diplomats in March. Poland had said the Russian diplomats were suspected of working for Russian intelligence. Russia has given the diplomats time till April 13 to leave the country.

405.title: I don't know about the big day myself: Neetu on Ranbir-Alia's wedding
405.article_body: Actress Neetu Kapoor, when asked about her actor-son Ranbir Kapoor's wedding to actress Alia Bhatt, told ETimes, "I would like to celebrate it and say it out loud. But kids today are different." She added, "I don't know about the big day myself, as both are very private people." She also said, "Alia and Ranbir are made for each other."
